loans.name: Mark Jerome

texts.en:
Mark Jerome is 18 years old from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. He is taking a certificate course on Mechatronics. He wants to finish his studies to help his parents and two siblings in achieving a better life.

Since his parents cannot sustain his schooling, he wants to avail himself of an education loan of PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders. He is hopeful that lenders will support his loan for this will truly help him with his school finances.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a generous woman. She was born in 1970. She is living in remote district and she is married. She has two children. Rano is a kind, communicative, hardworking and gentle person. She is busy with buying and selling stationery and nutrition products. 

She wants to better her standard of living and tries to work hard, serving clients very well to gain more income. Rano is requesting 10,000 TJS loan for buying additional products to store and to increase working capital.

loans.use: to buy nutrition products.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is an agricultural woman. She was born in 1967. She is living in the southern part of the country. She is married and has three children. 

For almost ten years, she and her husband have been keeping livestock. They keep animals and sell them in a domestic market for a profit. 

Muhayo was formerly a teacher. After the birth of her last child, they had some difficulties with finances. She decided to start an activity in the agricultural sphere, and to work hard at supporting her family.

She is now teaching at a secondary school until noon. Then she looks after the livestock, and every week her husband takes some cattle for selling at the domestic market. 

Muhayo is asking for financial support for buying horned cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy horned cattle.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, vive en el Distrito de Morropón junto con sus padres, la vida en el distrito se desarrolla pacificamente, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales. Está ubicado en la Provincia de Morropón que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Olga se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, piqueos, cerveza, actividad que desarrolla desde hace 2 años, también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de productos como cerveza y maíz para preparar la chicha de jora y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias, y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 35 years old, single and lives in the District of Morropón together with her parents. Life in this district is peaceful. The businesses and other activities operated by its inhabitants are agriculture, and the raising of livestock. It is located in the Province of Morropón which belongs to the Region of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru. 

Olga makes a living selling "chicha" (a popular Peruvian drink), beer and snacks, an activity which she has done for the past two years. She also works raising poultry in the back part of her home. She has applied for a loan to buy products such as beer and born to prepare chicha and in this way generate greater earnings, better profits and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as beer and corn to prepare "chicha."

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristita is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Cristita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nakry

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Presh Vihea province’s Ro Veang district, Nakry is a 64-year-old mother of one kid. She sells rice in the village to make a living while her husband farms rice. Having been in these businesses for 20 years, they can earn about 28,000 KHR per day.

Nakry has been with VisionFund for five cycles. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family income so as to make her living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman with three children. She is 44 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Merlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kimsor

texts.en:
Kimsor is a married mother of two children. She and her family lives in a village of the Ro Veang district of Presh Vihea province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cashews for more than 10 years, earning about 36,000 KHR per day.

Kimsor is in her fifth loan cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cashew nuts for growing.

With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy more cashew nuts to grow.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 54 years old and married with four children.  

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 38-year-old, married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosie has children who are in school.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish for her dried fish making.

Rosie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rosie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her dried fish making

loans.name: Irwan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Iwan. Iwan lives in Cibubur, located about a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his two children. Iwan owns a stall where he provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the third time he is asking for a loan from Kiva. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he has learned a lot about how to manage his business, as well as how to manage and increase his savings.

As the business grows, Iwan is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Iwan improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Iwan is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community.

loans.name: Bushra Noureen

texts.en:
Bushra Noureen is a 36-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and seven children.

Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 7 years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Bushra Noureen's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories; e.g. pieces of fabric, threads, needles and sewing machine accessories. 

However, due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for business purposes. 

Therefore, Bushra Noureen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance Bushra Noureen is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband fulfill his business needs.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is 19 years old from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. He has 6 siblings and their only source of living is through farming. With 7 children, his parents find it hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

In order to lessen his parent’s burden, Erwin wants to avail himself of an education loan of PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders to finance his own schooling. He is currently taking up certificate course on Mechatronics.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a seaweed plantation business in the Philippines. 

Sabina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her seaweeds production. She has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Sabina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her seaweeds production.

loans.name: Lugieta

texts.en:
Lugieta is 43 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lugieta has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Lugieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ronna

texts.en:
Ronna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ronna is 27 years old and has one child in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Ronna has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ronna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Siti. She lives in Cibubur, located about one hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her four children (two daughters and two sons). 

Siti owns a stall where she sells small snacks and provides mobile payment services to her community. She joined Ruma in 2013, and this is the third time she is asking for a loan from Kiva. 

She wanted to join Ruma because, as a woman, she wants to help her husband improve their life and learn about how to manage another business opportunity, as well as to contribute more to her community. 

As the business grows, Siti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. 

Now, knowing about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Siti improve her business, and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Siti is the one who is standing in front of her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to her community.

loans.name: Tehmina Almas

texts.en:
Tehmina Almas is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 27 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to have maintenance work done on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. His taxi requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to have maintenance work done on his taxi. 

Therefore, Tehmina Almas has applied for a loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Tehmina Almas's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transportation services to earn a more profitable income. Tehmina Almas also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Tehmina Almas is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to have her husband's taxi repaired

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and cooking pots

loans.name: Boinazar

texts.en:
Boinazar is a wise man. He was born in 1968. He is living in a rural area. He is married and has one child. He is a businessman. For almost fifteen years, he has been keeping livestock. He is planning to widen his activity and additionally plant vegetables and agricultural seeds.

Boinazar is a hardworking, wise, helpful and responsible person. He wants to make better his standard of living. The money that he earns is not enough to cover everyday expenditures.

He is asking a loan for 3,000 somoni to pay for family expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for family expenditures.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Eva requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Eva has been in this business for 32 years now.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is 38 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Sonia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers. Sonia has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and has one child in school. She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. 

Melinda has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like clothes etc. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like clothes etc.

loans.name: Roni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Roni. Roni lives in Cibubur, located about a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Roni lives there with his wife and his two sons.

Roni owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013, and this is the second time he is asking for a loan from Kiva. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he learnt a lot about how to manage his business, as well as about how to manage and increase his savings.

As the business grows, Roni is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Roni improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Roni is the one who is standing in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Jomima

texts.en:
Jomima is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Jomima has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business. She has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Jomima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 43-year-old woman, and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall; he sells different types of edible items like samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, kabab paratha, etc. He is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Parveen's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purposes, so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth, and earn a maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Parveen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is age 60, married to a construction worker, and they're blessed with eight children. She has been into a direct selling business for personal use items for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 monthly. 

In the picture, Elvira is holding brochures of varieties of products to distribute to her customers. Due to inadequate capital in her business, she would like to borrow a loan from those generous lenders amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase food supplements, beauty soaps, and coffee to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase food supplements, beauty soaps, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Teresita is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc. for her bakery business. Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Kos Krolor district, Soem is a 55-year-old mother of two children. She and her husband have been farming rice for 22 years. Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

Soem has been with VisionFund for seven loan cycles, and now, she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Soert

texts.en:
Soert is 53 years old and living with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Kos Kro Krolor district. Rice farming is the only main source of her family’s income. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 50,000 KHR.

This is the seventh loan for Soert with VisionFund. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to yield more crops from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Minerva is 24 years old now.

Minerva has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Minerva has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to continue to make improvements to his modest home; in this occasion, he will create separate rooms for himself and his children.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is a widowed woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 63 years old now.

Irenia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Irenia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is 55 years old and married with five children. With two children still in school, Gorgonia works very hard to provide for them.

Gorgonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, beer, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

Gorgonia has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, beer, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Gorgonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, beer, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Merian

texts.en:
Merian is a married woman with five children. She is 33 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Merian has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merian has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Merian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 25 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jennifer requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. She has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with four children. She is 47 years old and has three children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elena has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Elena requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es un joven de 21 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rigoberto a pesar de su corta edad se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia y es por ello que  para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia él se dedica desde hace 2  años a la compra y venta de verduras de la región pero también se dedica como jornalero para mejor la condición de sus ingresos, Rigoberto se dedica a esta actividad porque por el escaso recurso de su familia ya no pudo seguir realizando sus estudios, Rigoberto ahora quiere incrementar su negocio comprando papas por cuerda, pero una de las limitaciones que él tiene es que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para hacerlo, entonces Rigoberto se ha puesto de acuerdo con sus padres y ellos están de acuerdo con Rigoberto, entonces el ahora solicita un prestamo para comprar papas por cuerda.
Rigoberto tienen la esperanza de poder acceder a este crédito y poder realizar una buena inversión que le dejara buenas ganancias para que el algún día el puedo comprar su terreno donde pueda construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a young 21-year-old man, and he is single and lives with his parents in a neighborhood of Sololá.

Rigoberto, in spite of his young age, worries about providing the necessities for his family. For this reason and in order to earn income and take care of his family, he has made a living for the past 2 years buying and selling vegetables in the region. Also during this time, he has worked as a day laborer to improve his earnings. Rigoberto makes a living in these occupations because, due to the scarce resources of his family, he wasn't able to continue with his studies.

Rigoberto now wants to expand his business by buying a plot of land with potatoes (a 28 square meter area), but one of his limitations is that he doesn't have sufficient capital to do this. So Rigoberto has come to an agreement with his parents, and now he is requesting a loan to buy this plot of potatoes.

Rigoberto hopes to be able to gain access to this loan, and make a sound investment that will generate a good profit for him, so that someday he can buy land where he can build a house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land with potatoes.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. Jelly earns more income from general store.

Jelly is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy: corn, beans, cheese, vegetables, etc. for selling pupusas

loans.name: Silvia Guillermina

texts.es:
Silvia, elabora quesadillas y pupusas para vender, también practica la crianza de ganado y destazo de cerdos, todos sus esfuerzos son para generar los ingresos que utiliza para minimizar las necesidades de su  familia, en la zona ella es muy reconocida por su negocio y por ser una persona emprendedora, se encuentra acompañada, vive junto a su pareja y dos hijos menores de edad.
El préstamo lo invertirá en harina, aderezos, verduras, levadura, leche, cuajada, quesillo, etc., para elaborar la venta de quesadillas y pupusas, el resto será de ayuda para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para el ganado, espera recuperar la inversión con un buen margen de ganancias, las cuales serán de utilidad para minimizar las necesidades de su hogar.
Sus aspiraciones son apoyar a sus hijos para que se preparen académicamente y tengan un mejor desarrollo en la sociedad, además sueña con tener un negocio más popular y estable.
texts.en:
Silvia makes quesadillas and pupusas to sell. She also raises livestock and butchers pigs. All of her efforts are to generate income which she uses to minimize her family's needs. She is well-known in the area for her business and for being an enterprising person. She is accompanied; she lives with her partner and two young children.

The loan will be invested in flour, seasonings, vegetables, yeast, milk, Cuajada, Quesillo, etc. to make and sell quesadillas and pupusas. The rest will be helpful for buying feed and vitamins for the livestock. She hopes to recover the investment with a good margin of earnings, which will be useful to minimize the needs of her home. 

Her aspirations are to support her children so that they can be academically prepared and have a better development in society. In addition, she dreams of having a more popular and stable business.

loans.use: to invest in flour, seasonings, vegetables, yeast, milk, Cuajada, Quesillo, etc., to make quesadillas and pupusas to sell

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 29 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Barbara has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Barbara has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 40 years old, and her five children are still in school.

Elizabeth has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Corazon is 44 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Corazon has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay electric bills.

Corazon has been in this business for five years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay electric bills

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 47 years old and married with eight children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc..

Marivic has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coco lumber.

Marivic aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Johna works hard to support her family. She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from furniture making. 

Johna, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. is borrowing PHP 12000 to purchase nail polish, nipper, pusher and other materials needed for her manicure enterprise. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, nipper, pusher and other needed materials

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 41 years old and married with two children, who are still in school. Emelie works very hard to provide for them and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

With 12 years of experience, Emelie has a general store in the Philippines and sells items like shampoo, bread, coffee, canned goods, noodles, sugar, and eggs. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her store and help her meet her long-term financial goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is 62 years old and married with seven children. Priscila works very hard to provide for them.

Priscila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Priscila has been in this business for 16 years now. 

In the future, Priscila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Grupo San Jorge La Laguna Asesor Oscar Group

texts.es:
Rosa  (es la señora que aparece al lado Izquierdo de la foto) es una mujer casada que tiene siete hijos de las edades de entre 6 y 29 años de edad, Rosa tienen 48 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de San Jorge La Laguna.
Rosa es una mujer que lucha cada día para la generación  de sus ingresos, ella tienen un negocio de tortillería en su comunidad donde elabora una tortillas deliciosas ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, ha ella desde muy pequeña le enseñaron esta actividad lo aprendió con su madre cuando trillaban para darle de comer a la familia. Pero Rosa tiene una mente positiva con visión de superación y ahora quiere mejor sus servicios ella quiere incrementar su venta pero lamentablemente Rosa no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo es por ello que se ha unido a un grupo de mujeres para solicitar un prestamo que lo utiliza para comprar maíz y leña para preparar su nixtamal y elaborar sus deliciosas  tortillas.
La meta de Rosa para el futuro de acuerdo a sus ganancias ella puede buscar otros mercados para vender y generar más ganancias. Rosa tiene la plena seguridad de conseguir el prestamo y su sueño llegara hacer realidad.
texts.en:
Rosa (the woman on the left side of the photo) is a married woman who has seven children of ages between 6 and 29 years old. Rosa is 48 years old. She lives in a community of San Jorge La Laguna. 

Rosa is a woman who fights every day to generate her income. She has a tortilla business in her community where she makes delicious tortillas. She has made a living with this work for 10 years. When she was very small, she was taught this work. She learned with her mother when they threshed to provide food for the family.

But Rosa has a positive mindset with a vision of overcoming, and now she wants to improve her services. She wants to increase her sales, but unfortunately Rosa does not have sufficient capital to do it. It is for that reason that she has united a group of women in order to ask for a loan, which she will use to buy corn and firewood to prepare her nixtamal and make her delicious tortillas. 

Rosa's goal for the future with her earnings will be to look for other markets to sell and generate more profit. Rosa is sure that she will receive the loan and her dream will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aileen is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aileen has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from home products sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Corason

texts.en:
Corason, who is married and has a beauty salon in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. In business for six years now, she has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional beauty products for her salon.

Corason would like to build and expand her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Samina Begum

texts.en:
Samina Begum is a 30 year old woman, and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall. He sells different types of edible items e.g samosas, burgers, etc. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Samina Begum's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items in order to increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profits. Due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a position to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Samina Begum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn, is 32, not yet married to her live-in partner and they have one child. She has been selling ice cream in their town together with her live-in partner/business partner for almost one year and they earn a net income ranging between PHP 500-800 a day. Due to insufficient capital for their business, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase ingredients for making ice cream. She's hoping that her business will become more productive and profitable to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making ice cream

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 36 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge; tiene un hijo de 8 meses de edad; convive con su esposa hace tres años, vive en casa propia de material noble de dos plantas, mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros del distrito, es natural del distrito de Santo Tomás de Cutervo. Vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Jaime es la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, posee 6 reses de su propiedad, tiene una has. de inverna donde cría su ganado vacuno, se dedica a la actividad pecuaria hace 5 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes. También cultiva café variedad catimor. El destino del crédito será para la compra de ganado y sanidad del mismo, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 36 years old and has a stable home with his wife. He has a child of eight months and he has lived with his wife for three years.  Jaime lives in a solidly-built two story house with water and electricity; he is a native of the district of Santo Tomás de Cutervo. His community is basically dedicated to agriculture, the raising of livestock and commerce. and is located in the province of Cutervo in the region of Cajamarca in the northern highlands of Peru.

Jaime earns his living in the raising and sale of cattle. He owns six head and has a hectare of pasture (about 2.5 acres) where he raises his livestock. He has been working in the cattle business for five years, so he relies on his experience in the business and on good references from his clients. He also cultivates the Catimor variety of coffee. This loan will be dedicated to the purchase of cattle and their care, enabling him to obtain a better income to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: buy cattle and take care of their health

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is a very hard working entrepreneur from Pasay, Philippines. She is 55 years old and has two children, who are studying in preparatory school. She and Jerry, her husband, operate their buy-and-sell business. Income from their business is helping to meet their everyday needs and expenses.

Aniceta and her husband buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell products piecemeal for a little profit. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing, slippers, towels, and umbrellas to electronic gadgets like PC tablets. Customers are attracted to buy from them due to the low prices and the selection. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Aniceta is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes to prosper through her business by increasing her sales and her customer base. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es:
Santos Margarita tiene 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Morropón que se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además de el comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de tubérculos (papas), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 6 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El crédito será para la compra de calaminas, cemento y pintura para realizar reparaciones en su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Santos Margarita espera tener mayor comodidad en su vivienda lo que le permitirá vivir más cómodamente y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita is 52 years old. She lives in her own house with her children in the Morropón district, which is located in the Piura region, on the north coast of Perú. Life in the community is tranquil, and they make a living with agriculture and ranching, and the commercial sector as well.

She makes a living selling tubers (potatoes), work she has been doing for more than 6 years with experience in the business and with regular customers who provide very good personal and work references for her. 

The loan will be to buy corrugated metal sheets, cement, and paint to make repairs to her house, since currently it is in disrepair. With this, Santos Margarita hopes to have better comfort in her home, which will permit her to live more comfortably, and therefore will improve her quality life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets, cement, and paint to make repairs to her home, since it is currently in disrepair

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Judith is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 35 years old and married with six children.  With four children in school, Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gemma is 37 years old and has three children currently in school.

Gemma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Letecia has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 54 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Virgie has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Virgie requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Virgie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Virgie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway is a married woman with three children. Liwayway is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Liwayway is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Liwayway has a buy and sell jewelry and accessories business in the Philippines. Liwayway requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell to her customers.

Liwayway has been in this business for 10 years. Liwayway would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Genette

texts.en:
Genette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. 

Genette is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers for her buy and sell dry goods business.

Genette has been in this business for 6 years. Genette earns additional income from food vending.

Genette has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Genette dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 40 years old and married with five children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as toothpaste, shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as toothpaste, shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 44 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Adelaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Adelaida has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Adelaida aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with five children. Josefina is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josefina is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Josefina has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for 7 years. Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un joven muy activo tiene 24 años de edad, vive con sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Alfredo desde pequeño siempre se ha destacado con  la agricultura,  es un trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre y de sus hermanos,  en el lugar donde vive él es una zona muy fértil y da buena cosecha, pero según cuenta Alfredo que con los ingresos que obtiene del cultivo no le alcanza es por eso que también trabaja en una tienda donde mejora sus ingresos para apoyar a sus padres al mantenimiento de su casa. Pero Alfredo ahora quiere incrementar su cultivo, sembrando cebolla  pues estamos en la época de esta verdura, pero para hacerlo el necesita de un buen capital con el que el en este momento no cuenta, es por eso que el ha decidido realizar un prestamo de Q. 6000.00 para comprar sus semillas de cebolla, fertilizantes y fungicidas para sembrar.
La meta de Alfredo es hacer que esta inversión sea un buen inicio para seguir ampliando su cultivo y mejora sus ingresos para poder comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a very active young man. He is 24 years old, and he lives with his parents in a community in Solola. Starting at a young age, Alfredo has always done great work in agriculture. It is a job that he learned from his father and his brothers. The place where he lives is a very fertile area, allowing for a good harvest. However, Alfredo states that the earnings he obtains from his crops are not enough. For this reason, he also works at a store to improve his income so that he can support his parents with household expenses.

Alfredo now wishes to increase his crops by growing onions, as it is currently that vegetable's season. In order to do this, he needs money that he does not have at the moment. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan of Q 6,000 to buy onion seeds, fertilizers, and fungicides. Alfredo hopes that this investment will be a good start toward his goal of increasing his crops and improving his income so that he can buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, fertilizers, and fungicides.

loans.name: Lenilyn

texts.en:
Lenilyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lenilyn is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lenilyn has a buy and sell of beauty product business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional beauty products to sell.

Lenilyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lenilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additioanal beauty products to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 52 years old and separated.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Mercy has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

Mercy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom, 39, is married with two children residing in a rural village located in the Battambang Province’s Kos Krolor district, Cambodia. For the last five years, she has been farming rice to make a living. The current business earns her about 42,000 KHR per day. 

Yom has been with VisionFund for three cycles and now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Gulnora is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1982. She is living in rural area. She is married. She has two children. About ten years she is working at domestic market as a trader. She is buying and selling fruits. She has a got well experience in this sphere. She is planning to widen her activity. She knows well her job and tries to serve gently customers. That is why she attracts a lot of clients around. Gulnora is requested 1500 USD loan for buying fruits and increase her working capital.
texts.en: Gulnora is a hard-working woman. She was born in 1982. She is living in a rural area. She is married. She has two children. For about ten years she has been working as a vendor at a local market. She buys and sells fruits. She has a good experience in this line of work. She is planning to expand her activity. She knows her work well and provides a friendly service. That is why she attracts a lot of clients. Gulnora is requesting a loan of 1500 USD  for buying fruits and increasing her working capital.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Mastanai

texts.en: Mastanai is a hardworking woman. She was born and grew up in a village. She is married. She has four children. For nearly seven years, Mastanai has done business in the agricultural sphere. She plants agricultural products in a collective farm. She is an owner of that collective farm. She wants to get a good harvest every season. Her daughter-in-law helps her with planting and keeping plants. Unfortunately, her daughter-in-law is sick now. She needs to get treatment in a medical center. Mastanai is asking for financial support to treat her daughter-in-law in a medical center.

loans.use: To treat her daughter-in-law in medical center

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 57 years old and single with eight children.

She earns a living by a general store in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.

Helen has been running the store for 9 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina works hard to support her family and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business. Cristina has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush has many years of experience in farming and agriculture, which she started with her husband. These activities have kept her busy and she has new plans of developing her business with the help of this Kiva loan. She lives with her husband and single daughter in the village Ddmashen of the Gegharkunik region.

She has cows, pigs, a calf and also chickens. She says her farm is a cute one and that the income from it is good.  She obtains some milk, very little meat, eggs and potatoes. These are the farm products that she manages to sell at the city wholesale market. Her husband and daughter help her a lot and this help is great especially during the period of spring sowing activities.

She asks for this loan as she wants to be prepared for spring time, and she will buy diesel fuel, potato seedlings and also animal fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel, potato seedlings and also animal fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal lives in Irbid. She is a conservative woman and asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. She is 45 years old and married with three children. One of those children is Batool. 

Feryal, keen on raising her children and teaching them the best education, started her business making perfumes and selling them in her home. Her daughter Batool is studying civil engineering. She chose this major because she thinks that she will be successful, she will have a perfect future in this field and it will be easy to find work in this area. 

The father is retired and his pension is not enough to cover Batool`s university fees and Feryal suffers from a lack of sales these days. Therefore, Feryal applied for an education loan to help her daughter to pay her semester fees and the rest of the loan she will use to buy tools to help her to increase her products.

loans.use: To help her daughter to pay her semester fees and to buy tools to help her to increase her products.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Norma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and feed for her business.

Norma has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for her business

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Sakhorn is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living through farming rice. She earns about 35,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

This is Sakhorn's sixth loan with VisionFund. She successfully repaid the previous loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to harvest more crops to sell for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Berhanen

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Berhanen.  Berhanen lives in Cibubur, located about one hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Berhanen lives there with his wife and his only child. He owns a small stall where he sells small snacks, drinks and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time that he is asking for a loan from Kiva. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he learned a lot about how to manage his business, as well as learned about how to manage and increase his savings.

As the business grows, Berhanen is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on the weekends. This loan is very important. Your loan will be very useful to help Berhanen improve his business and, accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Berhanen is standing in his own small stall. 

He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 33, lives with her husband and two children in a village of Battambang province’s Kos Krolor district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost ten years. The current business earns her about 40,000KHR per day. 

Sokhorn has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles and has completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
Vith is age 33 and married with two dependent children. She lives in a rural village in the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district and has been earning a living through farming rice for seven years. She can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from the current business 

This is the sixth loan for Vith with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Hurshedjon

texts.ru: Хуршедчон молодой парень в возрасте 27 лет, он женат и проживает в сельской местности. Как и многие сельские жители Хуршедчон занимается откормом и разведением скота. Данной профессией он решил заняться в юном возрасте когда еще он учился в школе. Его отец занимался скотоводством и научил сына как правильно обращаться со скотом. Школу Хуршедчон так и не смог закончить из за финансовых проблем в семье. Хуршедчону приходилось пасти скот и ухаживать за ними, на учебу времени у него не хватало. Повзрослев он решил самостоятельно заняться откормом скота и постепенно смог увеличить свой товарооборот. На данный момент у него все деньги в товаре и для покупки корма у него нет денег. Цены на скот упали и Хуршедчон не может продать их чтобы не потерять часть прибыли. С данной проблемой он решил обратится в "АРВАНД" за финансовой поддержкой. На полученные деньги он хочет купить корм для скота. Хуршедчон заранее благодарен за предоставленную финансовую помощь малоимущим сельским жителям.
texts.en:
Hurshedjon is a young man of 27. He is married and lives in a rural area. Like many rural residents, he works fattening and breeding livestock. He decided on this occupation at a young age, when he was still in school. His father worked in animal husbandry and taught his son how to care for livestock. Hurshedjon was also unable to finish school due to family financial difficulties, so he started tending animals and didn't have any time left to study. Once he reached adulthood, he decided to start his own business fattening livestock and gradually was able to increase his working capital.

Currently, all of Hurshedjon's money is invested in his animals and he doesn't have enough to pay for feed. Livestock prices have fallen and he can't sell his animals without a loss. With this challenge in mind, he decided to approach Arvand for financial support. He wants to buy livestock feed with the loan amount. He thanks lenders in advance for their financial support of rural residents in poverty.

loans.use: to fatten and breed cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, and gravel to construct a home for his family.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
A resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan, Saira is a 45-year-old mother of four children.  Her husband, the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling all their needs, owns a printing shop. Saira has been running her own beauty salon for the past three years, combining her income with her husband's to manage the household. 

Saira has requested a Kiva loan to buy a variety of cosmetics such as creams, hair brushes, etc. for her salon in order to provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to increase her income to fulfill the needs of her family.

Saira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics such as creams, hair brushes, etc. for her salon business

loans.name: Shehnaz Begum

texts.en:
Shehnaz Begum is a 40-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 20 years. He alone is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Shehnaz Begum's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of clothes, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories, but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy the above items for his business purpose. 

Therefore, Shehnaz Begum has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to obtain the above tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Shehnaz Begum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his business

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann, 54, lives in a small community of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living and support her family, she opened a grocery store to serve people in her community. So far, she has been in his type of business for 15 years. On average, she is able to make an income of 4 USD a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фирузе 32 года. Она замужем. У Фирузы двое детей. Она с семьей живет на районе Шахритус. Шахритус находится на юго-западной части Таджикистана. Фируза вместе с мужем решили начать новый бизнес. Они планируют привозить из города Душанбе (столица Таджикистана) сахар и цемент, и продавать оптом магазинам и ларькам. Фируза с мужем решили вместе работать и зарабатывать, чтобы обеспечить своим детям светлое будущее и позволить себе дать им хорошее образование. Фируза обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "Хумо" поддерживает клиентов женщин и создает более выгодные условия кредитования. Для Фирузы и ее мужа сейчас важно каждая поддержка.
texts.en:
Firuza is 32 and married with two children. She lives with her family in the Shahrituz region, which is located in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. She and her husband decided to start a new business. They are planning to transport sugar and cement from the capital city of Dushanbe and sell them wholesale to local retailers. She and her husband decided to work together to earn money so they can give their children a brighter future and good education.

Firuza is requesting a loan because Humo supports female clients and offers more beneficial lending conditions. Every bit of support is important to her and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sugar and pay for transportation costs for these goods

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1991. She is living in a small town. She is married, and she has one child. Her husband left for Russia to earn money. 

Nasiba runs a business during the year. She serves women by doing manicures and pedicures at her home. She learned how to do manicures and pedicures in Russia. She completes her services beautifully and promptly. She attracts many satisfied clients. 

Nasiba wants to get a 5000 TJS loan to enlarge her activities. She is planning to buy a set of manicure equipment with a carrying case to allow her to further serve clients in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a set of manicure equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Panadol, Tabcin, pills, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 47-year-old resident of Pasay, Philippines, and she is married to Dominguito, a jeepney driver. She manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard for their children and to provide income for their everyday needs.

Jocelyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells a variety of supplies and merchandise through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that the dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, such as coffee products, toothpaste, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Jocelyn dreams to grow her business and save enough for the future of her family. She also aims to build their own house so there's no need for them to pay rent. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise products, such as coffee, toothpaste, soap and other personal products, that she sells.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy additional gallons and supplies needed in her water distribution business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow 8,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buy additional gallons of mineral water to increase her profit from the business. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Carmelita wants to operate a bigger water station that can cater to more customers. She also dreams of visiting her hometown. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Lucia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional wood, nails, and other materials needed for her furniture making business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood, nails, and other materials needed

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 31 years old and married with one child who is still in school.  Lea works very hard to provide for them.

Lea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, spices, etc.

Lea has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, and spices

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Divina has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials, such as abaca fiber, for her business.

Divina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, such as abaca fiber, for her business.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonida is 43 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Leonida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and sea foods to sell.

Leonida has been in this business for 9 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and sea foods to sell

loans.name: Fareeda Begum

texts.en:
Fareeda Begum is a 50-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of 5 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 4 years. He alone is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Fareeda Begum's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business, but due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Fareeda Begum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and also will be helpful for him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Fareeda Begum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Luisa works hard to support her family. She sells fermented shrimp in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Luisa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fermented shrimp to sell.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fermented shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Ester requested a PHP 21,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Ester has been in this business for 6 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Aileen is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other farm supplies for her fishing business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 28 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her weaving business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 39 years old and married with three children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarette, groceries, etc.

Editha has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buy & sell charcoal.

Editha aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarette, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bichiko

texts.en: Bichiko is 26 years old from the small village of Baghdati district. He lives with his wife. Bichiko is involved in agricultural activities. He owns a vineyard and produces vodka to sell locally. Bichiko is very motivated to increase his income and wants to start additional business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1100 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a cow and will start producing dairy products to sell. This will increase his income and with increased income he will be able to expand the husbandry business in future gradually.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nora works hard to support her family.

She sells coco lumber in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap. Nora is borrowing PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy more lumber to sell for her business.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatrez is 47 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school.
