Beatrez works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Beatrez has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Beatrez aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Luz is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She resides in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Cambodia. For the last 22 years, she has been farming rice to make a living. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Vorn has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her farming business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Phorn’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phorn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en:
Samath’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samath makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Hceun's Group

texts.en: Hceun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hceun makes a living cultivating rice and doing extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée et âgée de 60 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à Kpogan qui ne sont pas encore scolarisés. Ablavi est une fabricante de nattes qu’elle réalise à partir de la paille pour un usage modeste. Ablavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Atikpodji. Pour réaliser du profit en faisant des nattes de bons modèles à ses clients, Ablavi nécessite ce crédit pour financer l’achat des pailles qui lui servent à la fabrication de ses nattes.
texts.en: Ablavi is a 60-year old woman. She is married and lives in Kpognan with her two children, who are not yet in school. Ablavi makes and sells straw mats for everyday usage. She stocks up once a month at the Atikpodji market. In order to create good models for her customers and earn a profit, Ablavi needs a loan to finance the purchase of straw serving as her material.

loans.use: to buy eight stacks of straw and 15 units of thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit and a scale.

loans.name: Los Par Group

texts.es:
Juana(es la que aparece en medio de la fotografía de traje color gris)  es madre de familia  de 46 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos de las edades de entre 2 y 26 años,  y viven en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Juana es una mujer que se dedica a su trabajo, para prosperar con su familia,  a pesar de que se encuentra en una comunidad muy lejana, no es motivo de perder el tiempo, a Juana su mamá le enseño buenos principios que para prosperar en la vida hay que trabajar para generar ingresos, pues con esa mentalidad Juana desde hace diez años se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras en la plaza de su comunidad ella eligió esta actividad porque en la comunidad donde vive llegan compradores de lugares aledaños que necesitan de verduras frescas y baratas. Ella es vendedora  de piso plaza no cuenta con un local formal. 
Juana una madre que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y se ha visto a la necesidad de construir su casa para darle a su familia una mejor vida, pero lamentablemente que con las ganancias que ella obtienen no es suficiente es por eso que  ella decidió mejor buscar un prestamo  que lo utilizara para comprar materiales de construcción como: arena, bloc, cemento y hierro. Los sueños de Juana es poder construir su casa este año para brindarle a sus hijos comunidad y una vida mejor
texts.en:
Juana (who appears in the middle in the photograph wearing a gray outfit) is 46 years old. She is the mother of 7 children who are between the ages of 2 and 26. They live in a community in Solola.

Juana is a woman who dedicates herself to her work so that she and her family can prosper. Even though she lives in a remote community, she does not waste time. Juana's mother taught her good principles: in order to prosper in life, one has to work and earn an income. With this mentality, Juana has made a living buying and selling vegetables at her community market for the past 10 years. She chose this work because buyers from nearby places who need fresh and cheap vegetables travel to the community where she lives to buy. She is a street vendor, as she does not have a formal stall.

Juana is a mother who worries about the well-being of her family. She has realized that she needs to build a house in order to give her family a better life. Unfortunately, the earnings that she obtains are not enough. It is for this reason that she decided to request a loan, which she will use to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, brick, and iron. Juana's dream is to build her house this year so that she can give her children a sense of community and a better life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, brick, and iron.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Siem Reap province’s Sot Nikom district, Nhanh is 26 years old and married with two children, who are still small. She earns a living through farming rice. Together, they can earn about KHR13,000 per day from the current business. 
This is the second loan for Nhanh with VisionFund. The loan from VisionFund has helped her better support her family. Now she is asking for a loan to build a decent house. She hopes to have a proper house for living in.

loans.use: to build a a proper house for living in

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Soni kom District

loans.name: Chamangul

texts.en:
Chamangul is a cheerful woman who is a single student. She was born in 1996 and currently lives in a remote district. Chamangul is an active, brave, and helpful person. She is well-known amongst friends and students.

She grew up in a family of farmers, who had good conditions for keeping livestock and planting agricultural products. There are nine people in her family, and they keep busy by keeping livestock and planting agricultural products. After classes, Chamangul helps her family with keeping livestock and plantings.

Their plantings include potato, tomato, cucumbers and fruits, such as apples and pears. All of their products are sold in the domestic market. The income from their business covers family expenditures.

Chamangul's parents dreamed to educate their daughter in the university after secondary school graduation. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money to pay tuition. Chamangul is requesting financial support to pay tuition. She wants to be educated at the university. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира 43 года, замужем, двое детей. У Гульмиры среднее образование, с 2004 года в качестве основного дохода занимается торговлей одеждой, а также производством и продажей продуктов питания в арендованном магазине. Гульмира сама делает самсы, пирожные, пирожки. Ее товар в обороте составляет около 300,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS), средства она направит на развитие бизнеса по производству и продаже продуктов питания. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует использовать для развития своей деятельности, так как она хочет накопить на ремонт отопления в доме.
texts.en: Gulmira is 43 years old, married and the mother of two. She has received secondary education. Since 2004,  she has been selling clothing as a main source of income. She also cooks food for sale and sells groceries in a leased store. Gulmira prepares traditional "samsa" pies as well as other types of pies and pastries herself. Her sales volume is about 300,000 KGS. At present Gulmira's business brings in a monthly revenue of 12,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Gulmira has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS. She will use the funds to develop her food production and sales business. Gulmira plans to use the resulting revenue for her business growth since she wants to save up to repair the heating system in her home.

loans.use: to invest in her food production and sale business.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach lives in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Kos Krolo district. She is forty years old and married with a son. She and her husband earn a living by planting rice and corn. Having been in this business for twenty years, she manages to earn about 30,000 KHR per day.

This is Lach's third loan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lilit works hard to support her family.

She has a business direct-selling Natasha products in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store and selling electronic mobile load. Lilit is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more products from Natasha to sell, such as lotion, blouses, shoes, sandals, bags, and body spray.

Lilit has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Natasha, such as lotion, blouses, shoes, sandals, bags, and body spray.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Rodita works hard to support her family.

She operates a fish pond business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling crabs and fermented shrimps. Rodita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed for her fish pond business.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help to her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 49-year-old married woman who is blessed with three children. She owns and manages a business selling personal use products in their village. She has done this for almost five years and earns a daily net income of PHP 1,000.

Due to inadequate capital, she would like to borrow PHP 15,000 to purchase beauty soaps, face creams, and face toners to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve more and become profitable.

loans.use: to purchase beauty soaps, face creams, and face toners to sell.

loans.name: Lyka

texts.en:
Lyka is single. For the past five years, she has operated a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Lyka works hard to support her family. 

Lyka is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, coffee, cereals, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Loutis

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Loutis works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Loutis is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business.

Loutis has been sustaining her business activities through her recent loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Sot is a 39-year-old widow residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district. She has one child to take care of and earns a living through planting corn and rice. Having been in this business for eight years, she can earn about KHR 45,000 per day.

Sot has been with VisionFund for two cycles and is now applying for a loan to buy corn seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more corn so as to increase her family’s income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a 21-year-old married woman with a 1-year-old child. She sells food items and has been in business for two years. Claudine's husband is a teacher.

With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, green bananas, and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, green bananas, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson, aged 61 years, is a resident of Bungoma, a remote town in Kenya. He owns a small plot of inherited land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for more than 30 years. He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. 

The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family expenses. He needs to improve his income level, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Johnson passionately loves dairy farming; as he likes to put it, “Dairy farming is close to my heart.” 

He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow, but to buy a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income, and hence, improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and also towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from cow manure, which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm; hence, increasing productivity. 

Through the loan, he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Sokha is aged 41 years and married with two children. For the last eight years, she has been farming rice and corn to support her family. With the current business, she can earn about KHR 25,000 per day.

Sokha has been a member of VisionFund for two loan cycles already, and she completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to better support her family. Now, she is asking for another loan to buy corn seeds for growing. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for growing

loans.name: Mamao's Group

texts.en:
Mamao’s Group lives in a rural village in the Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Mamao makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a seller by selling coals to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom’s Group lives in a rural village in the Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokhom makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as farm laborer and seller by selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lorm's Group

texts.en: Lorm’s group lives in a rural village in the Battambang province in Cambodia. Lorm makes a living cultivating cassava and also works as a solider to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра очень добрая и вежливая. Она любимая жена и мать. Ее муж и сын являются певцами.  Гулчехра с семьей проживает на районе под названием Шахритус. Они поют на свадьбах, так как на районах мало праздников и в основном по выходным дням. Гулчехра чтобы поднять семейный бюджет взяла все в свои руки. Она решила начать новую деятельность, который прекрасно подходит под ее график работы и будет приносить больше дохода. Она будет заниматься животноводством. Гулчехра купит пару голов бычков и телят, откормит их в течение некоторого времени и после перепродаст их с наценкой. Гулчехра выбрала именно эту деятельность, потому что она может заниматься животноводством и параллельно заниматься домашними делами. Гулчехра хочет помочь поднять семейный бюджет и принести в дом источник дохода. Помоги Гулчехре в осуществлении ее планов.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a very kind and courteous person. She is a beloved wife and mother. Gulchehra and her family live in the Shahritus region. Her husband and son are professional singers. They sing at weddings as there are few other celebrations in the region, mainly on weekends. In order to improve the family budget, Gulchehra has decided to take the initiative herself. She decided to launch a new business that will fit perfectly in her schedule and bring in more revenue. She plans to raise livestock. 

Gulchehra will buy some bulls and calves, fatten them for a while and then resell with a mark-up. Gulchehra has chosen this type of work because she can raise livestock while taking care of her household at the same time. She would like to increase the family budget and have a source of income for the household. Please help Gulchehra  make her plans a reality.

loans.use: to buy bulls and calves to start her livestock business.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 37, lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. To make a living, he operates a selling Brohok (Salty Fish) business and earns, on average, an income of USD 5.00 a day. So far, he has been involved in this type of business for three years. 

Currently, he wants to extend his business by using a cart attached with his motorbike to carry the salty fish to sell around his community. Due to the shortage of money, he would like to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a cart. 

He hopes that this traveling sales business will allow him to double the earnings for his family. 

He is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cart for his salty fish business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as coffee, sardines, and spices.

Ruby has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sardines, and spices.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bindilin

texts.en:
Bindilin is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bindilin is 37 years old, and has five children who are in school.

Bindilin has an abacca business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials to use in her business.

Bindilin has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in her business

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Joanna works hard to support her family. She has a business selling “nipa” (thatch) roofing in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Joanna has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

Joanna is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy nipa to sell

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 44 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Leonita requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Leonita has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Leonita would like to save enough money to provide and secure the future of her family, expand her business, and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Apolinaria is 54 years old, and five of her children are in school.

Apolinaria has a vegetable-farming business in the Philippines. Apolinaria requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Apolinaria has been in this business for four years. In the future, Apolinaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nasaria

texts.en:
Nasaria is 49 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nasaria is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Nasaria has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from meat vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Chanra

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Chanra is 34 years old and married with two children. She earns a living through farming corn and selling grocery items. Chanra has run these businesses for seven years and is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day. She is in her third cycle with VisionFund and she completely repaid her past loans. Chanra smartly used her loans to gradually improve her living. 

Chanra is requesting a loan to buy corn seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice so as to earn more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 20-year-old single lady who lives with her family in Ajloun. She is a second-year student in university majoring in social services. Samah believes that nothing in this world is better than education and she thinks that a person with no bachelor degree is worth nothing. Her father retired from the army and his pension does not cover her education fees.

Samah is requesting an education loan for her semester fees. In the future, she wants to work in her field to help her family cover household expenses. Samah wants to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Sedreta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sedreta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear products. Sedreta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Sedreta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 29 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Daisy has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lyra is 45 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Lyra has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Lyra requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lyra has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
A 34-year-old mother of three children, Sreytouch resides in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been farming rice and planting corn for 12 years. Together, they can earn about KHR30,000 per day from the current business.

This is the third loan for Sreytouch with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for another loan to buy corn seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her family’s business, and gain more income to build some savings to increase her family’s business.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Pheon

texts.en:
Phoen, 41, is married with five children. She is residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Cambodia. For the last 12 years, she has been farming corn and rice as primary sources of the family’s income. The current business earns her about 50,000KHR per day.

This is Phoen’s third loan with VisionFund. 

Now she is asking for another new loan to buy corn seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn is aged 59 years and married with one kid. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, earning a living through farming rice and corn. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business.
 
This is Korn’s third loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. She is going to use her loan to buy corn seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more rice and corn so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Van is aged 44 years and married. She has three children. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and corn, and sometimes, they work for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 30,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Van has been a member of Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two loan cycles already, and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now, she is applying for a loan to pay labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay labor fees for plowing the field

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is a 64-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of the Battambang province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for seven years while her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 30,000 per day.

Mao has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is applying for a loan to buy corn seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income and to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una personas muy responsable, el vive en Solola, a sus 45 años de edad es soltera, tiene 4 hijos de las edades entre 7 y 25 año, Juana es una mujer muy  optimista  que sueña realizar muchas  cosas en el futuro. 

Esta perseverante señora se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica de su región, ella desde muy pequeña se dedicaba a esta actividad pues lo aprendió al lado de su madre y hermanas quienes también se dedicaban a esta actividad ella lo hace con el único propósito de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, Pues ella cada día siempre piensa en su familia,  y lo que Juana quiere es darle a su familia una casa, ya que sus hijos necesitan de  un hogar, Pero Juana no cuenta con suficiente capital para comprar materiales para construcción,  pues ella está buscando la manera de conseguir un préstamo para que el pueda empezar la construcción de una pequeña casa.
 
Las expectativas de Juana es conseguir el préstamo y hacer realidad sus sueños al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is a very responsible person. She lives in Solola. She is 45 years old, single, and has 4 children between the age of 7 and 25. Juana is a very optimistic woman who dreams of doing a lot of things in the future.   

This persevering woman makes traditional clothing from her region. Since she was very young, she has worked at this activity, which she learned at her mothers and sisters' side. They also work at this activity. She does it with the sole purpose of generating income and supporting her family. She thinks of her family every day and what Juana wants is to give her family a house, because her children need a home. But Juana does does not have enough capital  to buy construction materials. She is seeking a way to get a loan so she can start construction of a little house. 
 
Juana's expectations are to get the loan and make her dreams come true at her family's side.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks and gravel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a juki machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general store inventories for her brother.

loans.name: Hoeun's Group

texts.en:
Hoeun’s Group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hoeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Laura Raquel

texts.es: Laura de 30 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando el techo en la parte de atrás de la casa, pero como no tiene suficiente capital por esa razón solicita a INETGRAL un crédito para poder comprar laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y así ella y su hija puedan vivir mas cómodas y segura.
texts.en: Laura, who is 30 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her daughter. She has a store located in her residence. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of the expenses of her household. She wants to improve her home, installing a roof on the back part of the house, but as she doesn't have sufficient capital, she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to buy metal sheeting and purlins and pay for labor, and thus she and her daughter can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and purlins and pay for labor

loans.name: Nair

texts.es:
Nair es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es el comercio de plantas.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, paciente, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘San Pedro’ que es uno de los barrios más antiguos de la ciudad, escogido para albergar a quienes no pertenecían a la alcurnia, hoy es fiel testigo de los sucesos que ocurren en el centro, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 8-18 grados  paceño.
Nair es de tez trigueña, cabello rojizo, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija y sus hermanos, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de todo tipo de plantas como; ornamentales, de interiores, de exteriores, extranjeras, etc., “Estamos innovando los productos con plantas cultivadas mediante el injerto, tanto flores como también frutas…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande, abastecer a empresas y realizar ventas por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de plantas, abono y macetas para ampliar su oferta y mejorar sus ganancias. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nair solicita un préstamo para la compra de plantas, abono y macetas para comercializarlas a mejores precios.
texts.en:
Nair is a 35 year old woman. She is single and she has a 1 year old child. Her business is selling plants.

She is a good mother, generous, patient, kind, responsible and hardworking. She carries out her business in the ‘San Pedro’ area, which is one of the oldest neighborhoods in the city. It was chosen to home those who didn't belong to the elite. Today it is a faithful witness to the success that happens in the city center. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 8-18 centigrade.

Nair has dark skin, reddish skin, dark eyes, short stature, and a robust build. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her daughter and her siblings. They live in their own home, built of brick and adobe with a sheeting roof.  It has potable water, electricity, gas, and plumbing. Her business is selling all kinds of plant, ornamental, houseplants, outdoor plants, foreign plants, etc. “We are innovating products with plants grown through grafting, both flowers and fruits.” she says. Her dream is to have a big business, to supply businesses and to sell wholesale. She wants to buy plants, fertilizer and pots to expand her supply and improve her profits. This is her first loan cycle with the institution and she has been doing this activity for 10 years.  

That is why Nair is asking for a loan to buy plants, fertilizer and pots to sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy plants, fertilizer, and pots to sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Franklin Noel

texts.es:
El señor Franklin de 34  años de edad es soltero y  no tiene hijos que dependen de él, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio del transporte.
Doña Franklin solicita el préstamo para la compra de  llantas para su taxi y hacerle algunas reparaciones, Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su taxi y así poder atender más clientes en mejores condiciones, espera a su vez que esta inversión le permita obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia.
Uno de sus sueños es prosperar en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Señor Franklin, who is 34 years old, is single and has no dependent children. He lives in a community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. He has been working for three years in the transportation business.

Don Franklin is applying for the loan to purchase tires for his taxi and make some repairs on it. With the support of the loan, he hopes to improve his business and thus be able to serve more customers in better conditions. He hopes in turn that this investment will allow him to obtain the necessary earnings to get ahead with his family.

One of his dreams is to prosper in his business and improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2015.

loans.use: to buy tires for his business

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: La señora de Adelina de 18 años de edad conviviente hace 2 años, vive en una zona rural del departamento de Cochabamba. Ella y su esposo vienen de familias humildes de escasos recursos, se dedican a la producción agrícola con ingresos económicos que provienen de la venta estacional de papa y locoto, cultivan en terreno propio de herencia de sus padres con rotación de cultivos, de esta forma ellos buscan mejorar económicamente, actualmente necesitan un préstamo para hacer chaquear el monte para luego preparar el terreno y los productos agroquímicos,con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y por consiguiente las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Adelina is 18 years old and has been in a common-law relationship for two years. She lives in a rural area in the Department of Cochabamba. Adelina and her husband come from families with limited financial resources. They are farmers who earn their income from their seasonal sales of potatoes and peppers. Adelina and her husband cultivate the land that they inherited from their parents and grow crops on a rotating schedule so that they can improve financially.

They currently need a loan so that they can flatten a hill in order that their land can be prepared for planting. She will also buy agrochemicals. In the end, Adelina hopes to improve her income and also her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to flatten a hill so that her land can be prepared for planting and to buy agrochemicals.

loans.name: Yey's Group

texts.en:
Yey makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work selling coal to support her family. She has one girl in her family. Yey is the leader of a loan group from a rural village in Kompon Thom province in Cambodia. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Yey is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help the women in Yey’s group safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El señor  Fernando de 52 años de edad es casado , tiene  03 hijos  que depende de él,  vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 20 años  al negocio de la ganadería cultivo de maíz y cultivo de camarón.
Don Fernando es una persona emprendedora que produce leche a diario de su ganado y  gracias a que también tiene unas lagunas de camarón a podido salir adelante.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de concentrado para la crianza de camarón, con el apoyo de este crédito, desea suplir su necesidad de financiamiento. Este es su segundo crédito que solicita.
Don Fernando sueña con tener bien equipada su finca camaronera para que le de buenos ingresos y así tener una mejor forma de vida para él y su familia. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras –  Enero del 2015
texts.en:
Sr. Fernando is 52 years old, married, and has three dependent children. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras. He owns a house and has been in the businesses of raising cattle, growing corn, and cultivating shrimp for 20 years.

Don Fernando is an enterprising person who obtains milk from his cows on a daily basis. Thanks to this business, he was also able to acquire a few shrimp ponds, which allows him to get ahead.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy concentrated feed for raising shrimp. With the help of this loan, he will be able to fulfill his need for financing. This is the second loan that he has requested.

Don Fernando dreams of having a well-equipped shrimp farm so that he can generate a good income. As a result, he and his family can have a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2015

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for raising shrimp.

loans.name: Tony Alberto

texts.es:
Tony, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, sus padres siempre se han dedicado a cultivar hortalizas y por la falta de tiempo, no logro continuar en la escuela, está soltero y vive junto a sus padres y 3 hermanas menores.

Tony, junto a su padre siembra hortalizas, aparte de dedicarse a esta actividad, también trabaja de jornalero.- Sus cultivos están a una distancia de 2 kilómetros aproximadamente, sus cultivos necesitan de mucho cuidado, es por esa razón que tiene que estar muy pendiente a cualquier hora del día. 
	
Gracias al crédito anterior Tony, logro obtener buena producción en sus cultivos.- Ahora, con este nuevo financiamiento quiere seguir cultivando hortaliza, específicamente lo que quiere hacer es mejorar sus cultivos de ejote; el crédito será para comprar hilo de nailon, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra.


Con las ganancias que obtenga de estos nuevos cultivos, invertirá en nuevos cultivos y ampliar los existentes, pues era un deseo que tenia de ampliar más sus cultivos, para obtener  mayores ganancias económicas.

Tony, sueña con construir su propia casa, su propia familia y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Tony is 20 years old and studied through the ninth grade. His parents have always grown vegetables. Due to a lack of time, he was not able to continue school. Tony is single and lives with his parents and three younger sisters.

Tony and his parents grow vegetables. In addition to this business, he also works as a day laborer. His crops are located approximately two kilometers away and are in need of much care. For this reason, he is always on guard throughout the entire day.

Thanks to his previous loan, Tony was able to achieve good production from his crops. With this new loan, he wants to continue cultivating vegetables. Specifically, he wants to improve his crop of green beans. The loan will be used to buy nylon string and fertilizers, as well as pay for labor.

With the income he earns from this crop, Tony will invest in new crops and expand his existing ones. By expanding his crops even more, he hopes to generate better profits. Tony dreams of building a house of his own, starting his own family, and continuing his studies.

loans.use: to buy nylon string and fertilizers, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa 21 years old lives in Salt, she has five siblings, and she is on her third year in university majoring accounting information system.
Israa is an example of the ambitious girl and she has the hope of tomorrow. She believes that tomorrow will be more beautiful on all levels, she is seeking to end her education and moving to a good job which let her help her family in the household expenses and perhaps and hoping that this will help her father to return from work abroad and the family is reunited again. To be able to complete her studies at the university she applied for a loan to pay for tuition fees and to reach the goals that have always dreamed of.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ro Veang district of Presh Vihea province, Sokhim is a 34-year-old married mother of two dependent children. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for almost ten years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, she also sells grocery items in front of her house. Together, they can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet their family’s needs. 

Sokhim has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is applying for another loan to buy more grocery items to resell. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and also make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resale

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Seap

texts.en:
Seap, 39, lives in a small community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two single children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this types of business for more than twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 10.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy additional ingredients and supplies she needs to increase her viands and food items she sells. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional ingredients and supplies like meat, rice, veggies, condiments and seasonings. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Blesilda wants to give her family a better life someday. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and frozen foods.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through making barbecue sticks and tablea   (cacao chocolate). Rita has been in the business for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income. Rita is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo to make barbecue sticks and tablea. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Rita hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to make barbecue sticks and tablea

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Feme

texts.en:
Ma. Feme works hard to support her family. Ma. Feme is married woman with two children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Feme requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Ma. Feme has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and single.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad could not complete his studies because of the financial situation of his family. He got married and now he has two children. Amjad is doing his best to insure a good future for his children.
He thought of starting his small business, and he opened a place of water purification and treatment.
He has a malfunction in a pump which pumps the water, but to fix it would be costly. That leads Amjad to apply for a loan for repairing the pump and to buy some tools that increase the quality of his work.

loans.use: to repair the pump and buy some tools that increase the quality of his work

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en: Liberatha is 38 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 1 and 16 years. 5 of them go to school. She sells Irish potatoes and she has been in this business for 8 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes for sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Elvira has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elvira has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a natural medicines business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Evangeline is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of natural medicines to sell.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Fadil. Fadil lives in Cibubur, located about one hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Fadil lives there with his wife and his two sons. Together with his wife, he owns a small stall where they sell small snacks and provide mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time he is asking for a loan from Kiva. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he learned a lot about how to manage his business, as well as about how to manage and increase his savings.

As the business grows, Fadil is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Fadil improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Fadil is the one who is sitting in front of his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean is 39 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Chy Kreng district of Siem Reap province. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for seven years. To earn extra income, she also sells grocery items. With the current business, she can earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day.
This is the fourth microloan for Sean with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resale

location.town: Siem Reap province, Chi Kreng district

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en: Ma. Bella is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. Ma. Bella runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Ma. Bella has been in the business for more than three years now. This is her main source of income. Ma. Bella is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, cooking oil and condiments. A loan will help her improve her inventories, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Ma. Bella hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is thankful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan. It was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Violeta hopes that her business will thrive more for she desires to save more and renovate their home. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and married with eight children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bread, junk foods, groceries, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like bread, junk foods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn is aged 53 years and widowed. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district earning a living through farming rice and growing corn while her husband works as a worker to help earn income to support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR20,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 5,000 each day for the future needs.
Vorn has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is applying for a loan to buy corn seeds for growing. She hopes to make more rice and corn and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for growing

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en:
Maksim says that he feels very happy, since all his life, during many years, he has been engaged in two very beloved kinds of work in his native village Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. He used to work as a crane operator, and simultaneously little by little he established his farm, which today is the only source of income for his family. 

Now Maksim is 72 years old and he lives with his wife in their small and cute house which they once built on their own. Together they fluently and skillfully manage all the work about the farm, since the experience of their years helps them to make money from their farm products. Maksim has cows, calves, pigs and chickens on his farm. From the farm, Maksim’s wife sells milk macun (national-dairy product), as well as meat and eggs. Maksim thanks God that despite his age, he is still active and able to work. He properly cares for his farm cattle and he even cultivates potatoes on his plot of land, which he sells to re-sellers. 

Maksim, like all the farmers, stored fodder for his farm cattle, and the fodder is now gone. He will use this loan that he hopes to have for the purchase of some more animal fodder for his farm cattle until the spring period, when finally the field will be fulfilled with green and fresh grass, which solves the problem of animal fodder till autumn.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Sophea is 46 years old and married. She has one kid. The main sources of her family’s income are from cassava and rice plantation. Having been in this business for nine years, she is able to earn daily income of KHR36,000 to support her family. 
This is the third loan for Sophea with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR2,000,000 to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a living better and have a bigger house for living in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio  es un hombre de 49 años de edad, es soltero vive con su familia en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Rogelio  para generar los ingresos y mantener  a su familia, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de cocos en una calle que es muy transitada por turistas, él es muy reconocido por la comunidad y algunos lugares circunvecinos, Pues él también se dedica a la venta de presa libre en las calles de su pueblo. Rogelio manifiesta que  cuando empezó con estos dos trabajos eran muy rentables, pero al pasar de los años ahora existen muchas personas que realizan estos tipos de trabajos, y ya no es muy bien remunerada pero a pesar de eso Rogelio quiere hacer que su negocio crezca pero para hacerlo él no cuenta con un capital suficiente, es por eso que solicita un prestamo de Q. 2000.00 para invertirlo en su negocio comprando más cocos así también para su negocio de prensa.
El sueño de Rogelio en que esta inversión que va a realiza le deje buenas ganancias pues el cuenta que le beneficiara mucho este prestamo y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias para empezar construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a 49 year old man. He is single and lives with his family in a community in Sololá.

Rogelio, to generate income and take care of his family, has sold coconuts in a street where many tourists travel for the past 20 years. He is well-known in the community and other nearby areas. He also sells newspapers in the streets of his town. Rogelio says that when he began these jobs they were very profitable, but as the years have passed, many people have begun doing this type of work and now it doesn't pay as well. Despite this, Rogelio wants to grow his business, but he doesn't have sufficient capital to do so. For this reason he requests a loan of Q 2000.00 to invest in his business and buy more coconuts and also for his newspaper business.

Rogelio's dream is that this investment that he is going to make gives him good earnings. He calculates that this loan will benefit him greatly and in that way he will be able to earn more income so that he can start to build a house.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and newspapers

loans.name: Khursheed Akhtar

texts.en:
Khursheed akhtar is responsible mother of 10 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for five years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his Taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Khursheed akhtar has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Khursheed akhtar's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Khursheed akhtar  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Khursheed akhtar is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en: Mansour lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a 35-year-old married man and a father of six children. He who lives with his large family in a very small house which is not big enough for all of the family members. He is the sole breadwinner in his family. He is an employee with a public sector, for a small salary which is not enough to expand the house. Mansour decided to take out a loan of 195,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to build an extra room inside the house for his children. Mansour looks forward to opening a savings account in the bank for his children.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to build an extra room inside the house.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: Phal’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phal makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor and selling groceries to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chun's Group

texts.en: Chun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does work as teacher and tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Seun's Group

texts.en: Seun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokorn's Group

texts.en: Sokorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Santos Artemio

texts.es: Santos de 33 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros y sacos que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlas, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir solventando los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Santos, 33, has been working in agriculture for 10 years, and that has given him the skill and knowledge necessary for tending his crops. 

His land is mainly planted with corn and beans, and when his harvest is ready he stores it in the silos and sacks that are shown in the photograph in order to sell it later.

With the earnings he obtains from his sales he is able to cover some household expenses. He lives in his own house with his life companion. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of compost, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, etc., so that in this way he can have  better earnings and continue covering his household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  crianza de ganado lechero (producción y venta de leche)  en la zona donde reside, también a la agricultura. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasión para poder comprar vitaminas y ajustar para la compra de una ternera que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated in the picture because he is 26 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has for various years worked caring for milk cows (producing and selling milk) in the area where he lives, and also in agriculture. He has a very good clientele because he has known how to earn the confidence of his clients. He offers good quality and prices on his products, and with what he earns from his sales he can get ahead. The young man lives in his own home with his two children. He has decided to invest in the care of his herd because his business depends on it. For this reason he is requesting another loan, but this time to buy vitamins and to have enough money to buy a calf, which will permit him to grow his business. With this, he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue to give economic support to his home, which needs

loans.use: to buy vitamins and to buy a calf.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino is a driver and provides transport services to the people in his community. He is 57 years old and lives in Enrile with his family. He wanted to ensure safe travel to all his passengers but had insufficient funds to buy materials for maintenance of his jeepney. He is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP. He will buy gasoline, oil and tires for his jeepney. 

Someday, he hopes to continue acquiring good profits in the transport business for education purposes and to save funds for his family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, oil and tires for his jeepney.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, la joven vive con su hijo en casa propia y esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated in this picture because she is 27 years old and lives in a high risk zone, works in agriculture for the past few years. Her principal crops are corn and beans. She sells her produce in a buying and selling agency for basic foodstuffs that is close to where she lives. With the income she earns from her sales, she helps with her family's expenses. The young woman lives with her son in her own home and is requesting a loan so that she can buy fertilizers and other agricultural inputs that will help her to plant her crops, such as: manure, seeds, fertilizers, disease controls, and to improve the land that she shows in the photograph. This way she can have better income and continue to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, disease control and to improve the land

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy additional ingredients and supplies she needs to increase her viands and food items she sells. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional ingredients and supplies like meat, rice, veggies, condiments and seasonings. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Priscila wants to prosper in her business, for she wants for her children to finish their studies. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed to prepare her food.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
This is Ma. Victoria. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories she needs in her shop. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again in an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of her computer shop and also to pay for the maintenance of each unit. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the computer units are regularly maintained and in good condition.

Ma. Victoria hopes to be able to buy more computer units so she could increase her income and also to attract more customers. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 45 years old and has eight children. Ma. Theresa is married and has six children who are currently in school.

Ma. Theresa is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 41 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Catherine works very hard to provide for them.

Catherine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Catherine has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Catherine would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Girl Lou

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Girl Lou works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Girl Lou is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Girl Lou has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 64 years old and a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Diana has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Diana requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

Diana has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Diana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is a single woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Liza is 33 years old and has two children who are still in school.
