Kafui has the goal of buying other goods and is asking for this this loan to finance these purchases.

loans.use: to buy five lots of vegetables and two trays of tomatoes

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: Lucie est une femme veuve qui est âgée de 74 ans et s’occupe des charges de son enfant qui vit avec elle à Baguida. Malgré son âge avancé, Lucie vend des produits d’alimentations générales et arrive à couvrir ainsi ses charges quotidiennes. Lucie s’approvisionne au marché d’Attikpodji quatre fois par mois et alimente son étagère. Pour acheter de nouvelles marchandises, Lucie demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et réaliser le bénéfice pouvant servir à l’éducation de son enfant
texts.en:
Lucie is 74 years old, a widow, and takes care of her child who lives with her in Baguida. Despite her advanced age, Lucie works selling general food products and is able to take care of her everyday expenses.

Lucie procures stock four times a month at the market in Attikpodji. In order to buy new goods, Lucie is asking for this loan to finance her orders so she can earn enough to support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy one tray of tomatoes, six sacs of onions, and three packs of peppers

loans.name: Assiba

texts.fr: Assiba est une femme mariée qui vit à Adamavo et âgée de 28 ans. Assiba a la charge de ses cinq enfants et habite avec son mari. Pour contribuer à la bonne avancée de sa famille, Assiba vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans son quartier. Assiba s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé pour avoir son stock. Pour acheter  des paniers de tomates et les marchandises qu’elle vend, Assiba demande ce prêt pour effectuer sa commande.
texts.en:
Assiba is 28-year-old a married woman who lives in Adamavo. She takes care of five children and lives with her husband. 

To contribute to her family's development, Assiba sells general food products in her area. She procures her stock three times a month at the Grand Market of Lomé. 

In order to buy trays of tomatoes and the goods that she sells, Assiba is seeking this loan so she can place her orders.

loans.use: to buy two trays of tomatoes and four sacs of onions

loans.name: Inkerebutsi Group

texts.fr:
Bénoitte  fait partie du groupe  Inkerebutsi et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 52 ans et est mariée à J Baptiste, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 13 à 29 ans, tous étudient.
 
Elle fait le commerce du haricot, de  la farine de maïs,…dans sa boutique  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  du haricot et de la farine de  maïs à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Bénoitte is a member of the Inkerebutsi group and lives in Gitega. She is 52 years old and is married to a J. Baptiste, a farmer. Together they have six children, aged from 13 to 29 years old. All the children go to school. 

Bénoitte has worked selling beans, cornflour, etc. in her shop for ten years. 

She is on her 10th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy beans and cornflour to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy beans and cornflour to resell

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Adjoavi vit à Adamavo et est une femme mariée âgée de 29 ans. Grâce à son dynamisme, Adjoavi vend des légumes et fruits pour trouver une rentabilité pour couvrir ses charges quotidiennes et avoir une épargne considérable. Adjoavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Afagnan. Adjoavi sollicite ce crédit pour alimenter son étalage et faire encore plus de bénéfice pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Adjoavi is 29 years old, married, and lives in Adamavo. Thanks to her dynamism, Adjoavi sells fruits and vegetables and earns enough profit to cover her everyday expenses and to have a considerable savings.

Adjoavi procures her goods once a month at the market in Afagnan. She is seeking this loan to restock and make more profits that will support her everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy four sacs of vegetables and three trays of tomatoes

loans.name: Akwélé

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée, Akwélé est âgée de 39 ans et vit avec son mari et ses cinq enfants à Adamavo. Pour être participative aux besoins que nécessite sa famille, Akwélé vend des charbons de bois à la devanture de sa maison. Akwélé s’approvisionne deux fois par semaine auprès des fournisseurs du quartier. Akwélé veut passer une nouvelle commande d’achat de sacs de charbons de bois et demande ce crédit pour financer son approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Akwélé is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband and five children in Adamavo. In order to help take care of her family's needs, Akwélé works selling charcoal in front of her house. 

She procures her goods twice a week from local suppliers. 

Akwélé wants to make a new order to buy sacs of charcoal, and she is seeking a loan to finance this purchase.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of charcoal

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Ani Kayaran village with her husband and three children. Anahit's children attend local secondary school and together with her husband, Anahit runs their family farm. 

The farm includes livestock of cows, calves, sheep, pigs, piglets, and hens.  Additionally, it has arable land where a large variety of fruits and vegetables are cultivated (wheat, barley, apricot, peach, apple, nut and pear).
 
They sell the gathered agricultural products in nearby markets and get income for their living. 

To invest in her farming business and develop it further, Anahit has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase forage for the livestock and seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. 

As this is Anahit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not previously have access to credit because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for her livestock and seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Yanari Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Yanari de 33  años de edad, vive con su esposo tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella y vive en una comunidad del San Lorenzo, valle  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de ropa usada, su venta es de forma ambulante y en su casa.
Doña Yanari está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de cemento, ladrillos. Hierros y arena, para así poder terminar su casa la cual ya tiene más del 50% de construcción,   con el apoyo del crédito pretende mejorar su calidad de vida.  esta agradecida con Prisma por todo su apoyo que le brindan y espera así poder cumplir su sueños.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Yanari is 33 years old, she lives with her husband and has 2 dependent children. They live in their own house in a community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras.

She has made a living selling second hand clothes at home and as a street vendor for 5 years.

Yanari requests this loan to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron so that she can finish building her house, more than 50% of which is already built.

With the help of this loan, she intends to improve her living conditions. Yanari is grateful for all the support Prisma provides and she hopes it will help make her dreams come true.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January 2015

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron for her house

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugar cane and selling rice. Sonia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through the past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 43 years old now.

Maribel has a fish cage making business in the Philippines. She has requested an 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo and other materials needed for her business.

Maribel has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and other materials

loans.name: Ghulam Sakina

texts.en:
Ghulam Sakina is a 45-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, who is the mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past six years and he is responsible for meeting the needs of his entire family. Ghulam Sakina's husband wants to buy various goods for his store, such as rice, sugar, tea bags and milk. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of these. Therefore Ghulam Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy the commodities and also help him to earn a higher income to manage his household and business. 
Ghulam sakina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's store

loans.name: Umoja Katindo Group

texts.fr: Zahinda est un commerçant, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Umoja Katindo », âgé de 44 ans, marié à une ménagère, père de 6 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 2 sont gosses. Il est vendeur des boissons dans une buvette à domicile dans le centre ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter des bières Primus, Amstell, Mitziing et sucrées. Ainsi, il souhaite renforcer son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Zahinda is a retailer and member of the loan group 'Umoja Katindo'.  He is 44 years old, married to a housewife and father to six children, four of whom attend school, two are still too young for school.  He sells drinks from his home in the centre of town.

Zahinda has requested this loan to increase his business activities.  He plans to buy Primus, Amstell and Mitziing beers, and soft drinks.  He hopes that this will improve his working capital and enable him to educate and feed his children.  

Zahinda is grateful to the field partner, Hekima, for the support they offer to entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy Primus and Amstell beers and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a 58-year-old widow from the Zugdidi district of Georgia, who has a son and granddaughter. She earns an income from a running a stand at the local market, where she sells slippers and straws. Svetlana is unable to make a significant income from this, which is why the family finds it hard to meet all their daily expenses. She has a great desire to start another more profitable activity and has requested a loan for this purpose. Svetlana has received credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the requested amount, Svetlana plans to open a beauty salon locally and create a stable source of income for her family. She has already found a place and needs money to buy all the needed furniture and tools to make a comfortable place for customers. 
Svetlana and her family are really grateful for the chance that Kiva lenders can give them, to create financial stability and a significant source of income.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Akoélé est une femme mariée de 34 ans qui vit à Gabadakodji avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Pour faire son revenu et  venir en aide aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille, Akoélé vend des oignons et piments afin d’avoir la rentabilité favorable. Akoélé s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé deux fois par mois. Pour avoir son stock de piments et d‘oignons, Akoélé demande ce prêt pour financer son achat et réaliser le bénéfice souhaité.
texts.en:
Akoélé is 34 years old, married and lives in Gabadakodji with her husband and two children.  In order to earn a living and provide for the expenses of her family, Akoélé sells onions and chillies.  She buys her supplies from the main market in Lomé, twice a month.

Akoélé has requested this loan in order to buy further supplies and make a profit.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of onions and 5 baskets of chillies for resale.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée de 36 ans, Afi vit à Gabadakondji et s’occupe de ses deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Pour soutenir son mari et participer activement à l’avancée de son foyer, Afi vend du riz préparé dans un établissement scolaire pour avoir le revenu nécessaire. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par semaine au marché d’Akodessewa. Pour acheter les sacs de riz et les ingrédients intervenant dans la préparation du riz, Afi demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et avoir le résultat souhaité.
texts.en:
Afi is 36 years old, married and lives in Gabajakondji where she looks after her two children, who both attend school.  In order to help her husband to provide for the improvement of their household, Afi sells prepared rice at a school.  She buys her supplies twice a week from the market in Akodessewa.

Afi has requested her loan to be able to buy sacks of rice and other ingredients necessary for the preparation of the meals she sells.  This will provide her with a profit.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice, 1 drum of oil and 1 box of spaghetti for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of perfume for sale.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 35-years-old and lives in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. She is a mother of three children, all of them are school aged (a son and two daughters). Naira’s husband engages in farming and agriculture with her. Their family is one of those in the village that is developing swine breeding on the farm. On her farm Naira has cows, calves, pigs and chickens. She mentions that she is not satisfied with her farming. She has great plans of increasing the number of pigs to sell more pork to the city butcher, who usually bring great orders to farms that specialize in swine breeding. 

This loan in the amount of 500,000 Armenian drams will be used to buy pigs and piglets in order to earn more from pork selling.

loans.use: to buy pigs and also a piglet.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 63-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown children from Merida, Leyte. 

She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than three years now. This is her source of her income. 

Erlinda is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley, 36, is a married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Shirley has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.  

Shirley requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Villa works hard to support her family.

She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Villa is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her raising pigs business.

Villa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven muy creativo, que busca atraer cliente con diseños y publicidad exclusiva, su forma rara, pero innovadora de decorar su espacio hace que los clientes queden impactados al ver algo tan diferente de lo comúnmente visto.
Tiene una barbería que el mismo decoro, y esas excentricidades son la que ha generado éxito, y con ello mantiene a su familia que la conforma su pareja y un pequeño de un año de edad. 
Ahora con el apoyo de un crédito quiere seguir materializando sus ideas locas, y necesita un poco de capital para invertir en un parasol, mueblería, tv y otros y así hacer de un corte de peinado una grata y agradable experiencia. 
Vale la pena apoyar la creatividad de este joven que con resultados muestra que si vale la pena prestarle.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very creative youth who seeks to attract clients through exclusive publicity and designs. His innovative but unique way to decorate his space leaves his clients impressed seeing something so distinct from the normal.

He has a barber shop that he has decorated himself and these eccentricities has generated success and with it he can support his family made up of his partner and a one year old son. Now with the help of the loan he wants to continue to carry out his crazy ideas and he needs some capital to invest in an umbrella, furniture, a TV and others and thereby making a haircut into a pleasing and agreeable experience. It is worthwhile supporting the creativity of this youth who has shown by his results that it is worth the effort of lending to him.

loans.use: to invest in an umbrella, furniture, a TV and others.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Merida, Leyte.  

She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than five years now. This is her source of income. 

Analiza is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. Analiza also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 40 years old, a father of three, and happily married to a housekeeper. For ten years he has worked as a food vendor, selling street foods and snacks as he visits villages on his motorcycle vending cart.

Fernando requests a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy products to sell, like fish balls, hot dogs, and powdered juice for cold drinks. Fernando hopes to grow his business to sustain the needs of his children. Their education is his priority and will be supported with the additional income he will earn from his small business.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Merida, Leyte. She is engaged in a hog-raising business. 

Marilyn is requesting to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her profit and income. 

In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her hog-raising business in order to generate more revenue. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario is a 68-year-old married man and a father of five grown children from Merida, Leyte. He earns a living through a hog-raising business. This is his source of income for more than three years now. His wife used to work as teacher in their place. 

Apolinario is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help him improve his hog-raising business, thus augmenting his profit and income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Bad-Run-Nisa

texts.en:
Bad-Run-Nisa is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her seven children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. 

Bad-Run-Nisa is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services. Bad-Run-Nisa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves to raise and fatten thus increasing her cheese production.

loans.name: Gaioz

texts.en:
Gaioz is 54 years old and married, living in the village Orsantia. His wife is temporarily unemployed, and Gaioz can't find a stable job due to the high unemployment rate in the region. The couple is involved in agribusiness for financial stability. They own a plot of agricultural land, where they harvest nuts, and Gaioz cares for a sow pig. The income, however, is not enough to cover their basic needs.

Gaioz began seeking a start-up loan for a bakery. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions and earnings. A joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural and inexperienced people to qualify for loans by starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved by this program for a loan of 1500 GEL to open a bakery. Gaioz will be able to purchase all equipment and supplies and start his own business. His wife will work with him, baking various kind of cakes, as well as filling private orders. 

The new business initiative will be a great support to this motivated man and his family, as they will have a significant source of income and increase their financial and living conditions.

loans.use: to open a cake bakery.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre trabajador, amigable, honesto y de buen corazón, se encuentra actualmente casado, es padre de 4 hijos ya ellos mayores de edad y tiene una actividad económica muy bella y dirigida a un público fantástico, tiene un hotel para pensionado y mayores de edad, decidió hacer de estos sus usuarios objetivo por ser una población muy marginada y descrinada hoy en día.
Con la ayuda de un préstamo Marco quiere hacer de este espacio un sitio mas agradable y cómodo por ello quiere invertir dicho préstamo en la compra de camas para cambiar las que actualmente tiene, comprar enfriadores para guardar comida, siendo estos dos necesidades de primera en su hotel.
Con las ganancias quiere comprar una vivienda y hacer de este un sitio para estos amigos tan discriminados.
texts.en:
Marco is a hard-working, friendly, honest and good-hearted man. He is currently married, the father of 4 adult children, and has a very lovely job aimed at a fantastic public. He has a hotel for pensioners and elderly people. He decided to make them his target users because they are a population very marginalized and discriminated against these days. 

With the help of a loan, Marco wants to make this space more pleasant and comfortable, so he wants to invest this loan in the purchase of beds to replace the ones he currently has and to purchase refrigerators to keep food, since these are the two primary needs of his hotel. 

With the earnings, he wants to purchase a house and make this a place for these friends so discriminated against.

loans.use: to purchase beds to replace the ones he currently has, to purchase refrigerators to keep food, these being the two primary needs in his hotel.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.es:
Urbano tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su zona. El crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Urbano espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Urbano is 36 years old and lives with his spouse and their two young children in Pucará district, which is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this district is peaceful; the population works in agriculture, raising animals, and trade.

He works growing coffee. He has 10 years of experience in this field and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop and to hire laborers for the harvest season. With this, Urbano hopes to offer better quality coffee to his customers, which will increase his level of sales, with the end of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his crop and also to hire laborers for the harvest season.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to make repairs on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make repairs on his taxi. 

Therefore Rabia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Rabia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn more profitable income. 

Rabia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Rabia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Mahusiano Grp Musoma Group

texts.en:
Hawa, who is in her late 30s, is single with four children who are still at school. She has been running a small scale retail shop for four years now.  She works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hawa's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase the scale of her retail shop.  She dreams of expanding her business.  

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group "MAHUSIANO GRP MUSOMA" which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the scale of her retail shop.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a very enterprising and tenacious man with big dreams that he has been cultivating and trying to fulfill. He is a smallholder farmer who lives together with his family in Kapsowar, a rural town neighboring the famous Rift valley. On a small piece of land he keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows maize and vegetables. He has been doing this work for more than 5 years. He also makes extra money engaging in other seasonal businesses. Paul is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He takes deep pride in being a dairy farmer: “Dairy farmers enjoy self-support. We are independent. We live in beautiful surroundings with our animals.” Paul’s unhurried lifestyle gives him time to look after his animals as individuals. Paul finds farming to be fulfilling and lucrative: “Farming has been a good source of income!” However, his biggest challenge is poor roads leading to the market. This makes transportation very costly. With this loan, Paul will make more money from his dairy sector due to increased milk production. This will enable him to pay, comfortably, his highest monthly expense – school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Paul replied that it would improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a 24-year-old married woman from Merida, Leyte. She makes a living through a hog-raising business. Elsie has raised pigs for several years now. Elsie would like to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Elsie dreams of making her hog raising business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Jesita

texts.en:
Jesita is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors, pupils, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. Jesita dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan of 50,0000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and 10 kgs of beans. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and 10 kgs of beans.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Pabla es una mujer ambiciosa, que siempre busco su horizonte, desde pequeña mostro gran fanatismo por el trabajo independiente, pero al caer en embarazo parto con muchos sueños por dedicarse de lleno al cuidado de su pequeña que hoy tiene 10 años de edad.
Su hija la tener una edad considerable quiere retomar sus sueños y crear una actividad económica para mantenerse pues no sabe cuándo le pueda faltar su esposo o cuando atraviesen por una situación muy complicada.
Con la ayuda de un préstamo quiere iniciar a ofertar sus servicios de hospedaje y el monto del préstamo lo justifica en que necesita realizar adecuaciones a la cocina y baño para hacerlos más amplios y cómodos para los futuros huéspedes.
texts.en:
Pabla is an ambitious woman, who always seeks her horizon. Since she was little, she showed a strong passion for independent work, but when she became pregnant, she left behind many of her dreams to focus completely on taking care of her little one, who now is 10 years old.

Since her daughter is at a good age, she wants to take up her dreams again and create work to maintain herself, since she doesn't know when her husband might be lacking or when they would go through a very complicated situation.

With the help of a loan, she wants to begin to offer her hospitality services and the amount of the loan is justified in the need to make improvements to the kitchen and bathroom to make them larger and comfortable for her future guests.

loans.use: to expand the kitchen and make improvements to the bathroom of her hotel.

loans.name: Madelia Rosa

texts.es:
Ella es Madelia, una modesta mujer de 38 años de edad, muy trabajadora, casera, amante del buen sabor, responsable, y muy recta en sus pagos, es responsable de 4 hijos de 18, 14, 16 y 13 años de edad, y como toda madre preocupada quiere darle estudio y lo mejor que este a su alcance para que se formen y sean personas de bien para la sociedad.
Madelia se desempeña como vendedora de alimentos, como fritos, desayunos almuerzos los cuales prepara en el espacio que se puede apreciar en la foto.
Sus preparaciones las hacen a fuego de leña, es un proceso muy demorado, y ya que quiere mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, ser más competitivo le gustaría invertir en la compra de una estufa para preparar algunos alimentos de manera más óptima. 
Con tu apoyo esta empresaria tendrá otra manera de preparar sus alimentos pudiendo preparar mayor cantidad en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Madelia is a modest woman, 38 years old, very hard working, a homebody, a lover of good flavor, responsible, and very strict with her payments. She is responsible for four children, ages 18, 14, 16, and 13 years old, and as a concerned mother, she wants to provide them with education and the best that is in her reach so they are trained and become good people for the society.

Madelia works selling foods, such as fried foods, breakfasts, and lunches, which she prepares in the space that can be seen in the photo.

She makes her meals on a wood stove; it is a very slow process, and since she wants to improve her earnings and increase her customer base, to be more competitive, she would like to invest in the purchase of a stove to prepare her dishes in a more optimal way.

With your support, this businesswoman will have another way to prepare her dishes, being able to prepare a larger quantity in a shorter time.

loans.use: to purchase a stove to prepare some dishes in a more optimal way.

loans.name: Gul Bano

texts.en:
Gul Bano is a 43-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and six children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 5 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family.

Gul Bano's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g. pieces of clothes, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not able to buy these items. Therefore Gul Bano has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband so that he can obtain these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs.

For this financial assistance, Gul Bano is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's business.

loans.name: Carmen Teresa

texts.es:
Carmen es un perseverante, trabajadora y soñadora mujer cabeza de familia de 35 años de edad, tiene un pequeño de 5 años y con su negocio de arreglo de uñas genera los modestos ingresos con los que se mantiene su hogar.
Carmen quiere mejorar sus ganancias, mejorar su condición de vida, se cansó de tener un estilo de vida bajo, quiere mejorar y buscar un mejor futuro para ella y su hija que juntas salgan de esa condición porque se lo merecen. 
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de motilar, esmaltes y cremas faciales para iniciar una trasformación de su negocio en un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Carmen is a persevering, hard-working, and visionary female head of the family. She is 35 years old, has a 5-year-old child, and with her nail care business generates a modest income with which she maintains her household.

Carmen wants to increase her earnings and improve her living conditions. She is tired of having such a low life style and wants to improve and look for a better future for herself and her daughter so that together they get out of this condition because they deserve it.

She asks for a loan to purchase hair clippers, nail polish and face creams to begin a transformation of her business into a beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase hair clippers, nail polish, and face creams to start a transformation of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, cutlery, dishes, and tablecloths.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer de gran fortaleza, ama de casa, dedicada a la familia  a sus 60 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y responsable de su hogar debido a que su esposo falleció y hoy es una mujer solitaria que genera ingresos gracias a su negocio de cría de aves. 
Dicha actividad la adopto por mera necesidad, es lo que sabía hacer y con esto ha logrado quitar el hambre de su estómago y soportar el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Josefina necesita gran apoyo tuyo, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, no tiene una persona en quien apoyarse por lo que tu apoyo la hará sentirse que tiene alguien que cree y confía en ella, con un crédito quiere construir un estadero para pollos y gallinas, comprar gallinas y pollos para abastecerlo y así mejorar el flujo de ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina is a woman of great strength.  She is a housewife and devoted to her family.  She is 60 years old and has two children.  She is responsible for her household because her husband passed away.  She is now a solitary woman who generates income thanks to her business of raising poultry.

She took up this business activity out of pure necessity.  It is what she knew how to do, and with this she managed to satisfy the hunger in her stomach and support the maintenance of her household.

Josefina needs your great support in order to improve her living conditions.  She does not have anyone to help her.  That is why your support will make her feel that she has someone that trusts and believes in her.  With a loan she wants to build a poultry house and buy hens and chickens to stock it.  This way she will improve the sales flow in her business.

loans.use: to build a poultry house and to buy hens and chickens to stock it.

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en:
31-year-old Veasna is a married woman with four young children. They are living in a village in Kratie province.

Her primary source of income is from selling vegetables at the market. She can save up to 6 USD per day. Although this is the first time Veasna is with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is the leader of her group. 

She is applying for a 1,400,000 KHR loan for her grocery store. It is to buy vegetable stock. She hopes that it will help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable stock

loans.name: Melchie

texts.en:
Her name is Melchie, 37, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Aldrin, a vendor, and has four children of which one is a college student, one is a high school student, one is in the elementary level, and the other one is not of school age yet. She manages their own household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily sustenance and for the schooling of her children.

Melchie has a rag-making business. She makes and sells rags for different uses and various sizes. There are round palm sized ones to clean cabinets and kitchen counter to large doormats. In the Philippines, rags are a major housekeeping and cleaning item, and every household has them. Filipino households constantly change and buy clean rags to keep their houses clean and presentable. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from her rags, she also sells accessories and herbal oil. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy additional materials like fabric, thread for her rag business and partly to pay for accessories which she sells. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help cover their daily needs and fund her children's education.

Melchie hopes to sustain her business and desires to send all her kids to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics and thread for her rag making business, and accessories and herbal oil which she sells

loans.name: Chomreun

texts.en:
A Dambae resident of Kampong Cham province, Chomreun is 29 years old and married with two children. One of her children is in primary school, while the other is under 6 years old.

To support the family, Chomreun and her husband have been planting cassava for the last 11 years. She also raises chickens for additional income. The family is able to keep 7 USD daily for future uses. Chomreun has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, three times including now.

She is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR for her cassava plantation. Her plan is to buy fertilizer and pesticide, as well as to hire workers to work on the plantation. She hopes that the profit from her cassava sale will enable her to expand her plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to hire workers

loans.name: Ey

texts.en:
An elderly villager of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ey is a widower with six children, and three of the children are living with him.

Ey has a cassava plantation that he has been doing for 45 years. In addition, he is a rice farmer besides having the cassava plantation. He manages to save 7 USD per day.

As a new member of Kiva’s partner (VisionFund), Ey is seeking a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and cassava stems for his plantation. His goal is to expand his cassava business so that he can earn more profit to support the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and cassava stems

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel etc. for his business

loans.name: Aissa

texts.pt:
A senhora Aissa é solteira, mae de 04 filhos maiores de idade. Dentre eles 2 estão na sua responsabilidade, para alem dos seus filhos toma conta ainda do seu neto cuja mae faleceu..
 Com o emprestimo pretende comprar pintos, vitaminas e raçao para a criaçao de frangos e posteriormente vender aos residentes do seu bairro e outros. O seu sonho é alargar seu negocio e  ter outros mercados e, o seu maior desafio é conseguir reembolsar o emprestimo sem moras
texts.en:
Mrs Aissa is single and the mother of 4 children who are all of age. Among them 2 are still under her care and she also takes care of her grandson whose mother passed away.

With this loan she plans to buy chicks, vitamins and ration to breed chickens and sell them to her neighbours and further afield. 
Her dream is to expand her business and to have other markets. Her biggest challenge is to pay back her loan without any delays.

loans.use: buy chicks, vitamins and ration to breed chickens

loans.name: Meneses

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Maputo tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, apenas 2 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha como segurança a mais de 6 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, varões e outros que forem necessário. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e garantir educação dos filhos. O seu maior desafio é terminar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Meneses was born in the Province of Maputo, is 31 years old, lives with his wife and is the father of 3 underage children. Only 2 of them go to school and he has no one else under his care.

He has worked as a security guard for more than 6 years and the money he makes goes towards his household expenses. With this loan he plans to continue the building work on his home by buying construction materials such as sand, cement, rods and other necessary items. This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku.

In future he plans to finish building his house and guarantee his children's educations. His biggest challenge is getting the construction work completed.

loans.use: buying construction materials such as sand, cement, rods and other necessary items

loans.name: Gloria Susana

texts.es:
Gloria Susana es una señora muy entusiasta y amable que trabaja muy duro todos los días para darle lo necesario a su familia que se compone de 3 hijos y su esposo. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, está casada. 

Ella se dedica con mucha alegría y firmeza a la compraventa de ropa típica de diferentes estilos y precios. Ella vende su producto en el piso plazo del central de mayoreo de su comunidad. Esta actividad le gusta realizarla porque por medio de ella se relaciona con su comunidad y conoce a muchas personas; además de ello le genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Tiene muchos años de experiencia en esta actividad porque ella empezó a ejercerla desde muy joven aprendiendo de algunas amigas y de su familia.

 Gloria Susana es una madre de familia que se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia ella desde hace un tiempo ha comenzado a construir su casa junto con su esposo pero ellos en este momento ya no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para terminar de construir la casa, es por ello que solicita un prestamo de Q. 3000.00 para compra cemento, bloc y todo lo que la construcción necesite para terminar de construir.

El sueño de Gloria Susana es poder contar con este crédito y terminar el construcción lo más pronto posible, para ofrecerle a su familia más seguridad
texts.en:
Gloria Susana is a very enthusiastic, friendly woman who works very hard every day to give her family what they need. Her family is made up of her husband and three children. She is 30 years old and married.

She makes a living buying and selling clothing of various styles and prices with plenty of joy and determination. She sells her products in the central wholesale plaza of her community. She likes this business activity because she is connected to her community and she meets many people. She also earns the necessary income to cover her family's basic needs. She has many years of experience in this business because she started at a very young age, learning from some friends and her family.

Gloria Susana is a mother who worries about her family's needs. Some time ago, she started construction on her house along with her husband, but they do not have the necessary funds to finish construction at the moment. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of 3000 Guatemalan quetzals to buy cement, blocks, and everything they need to finish construction. 

Gloria Susana's dream is to have the support of this loan and to finish construction as soon as possible to offer her family greater security.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, whitewash and iron.

loans.name: Rafilla

texts.en:
Rafilla is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a garment shop for past 5 years. 

Rafilla's husband wants to purchase different types of garment accessories for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Rafilla has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Rafilla is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's garment business

loans.name: Anita

texts.pt:
A sra Anita é solteira, mae de 02 filhas que frequentam o ensino secundario e estao na sua responsabilidade. Vende frutas numa das ruas movimentadas da sua zona.
Está a construir uma casa para confortar as suas filhas e com o emprestimo pretende comprar janelas, portas e cimento para concluir a sua casa. O desafio da sra Anita é pagar o credito para poder solicitar outros emprestimos.
texts.en:
Mrs Anita is single and the mother of 2 daughters who go to college and are still in her care. She sells fruit on a busy street in her neighbourhood.

She is building  house to provide more comfort for her daughters and with this loan she plans to buy windows, doors and cement to complete it. Her challenge is to pay off this loan so that she can ask for further loans.

loans.use: buy windows, doors and cement to complete her house

loans.name: Catarina

texts.pt:
A sra Catarina é casada e mãe de 05 filhos que estão na sua responsabilidade. O  seu esposo é carvoeiro. Dos seus filhos, um é que nao tem idade escolar e os restantes frequentam a escola.
Com o empréstimo, pretende comprar cervejas, refrigerantes, carnes, feijao, arroz , azeite para revender na sua barraca, porém, o seu sonho é construir uma mercearia para fornecer quase todos os produtos da 1ª necessidade aos residentes da sua comunidade.
Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, o seu desafio é reembolsar o crédito dentro do prazo acordado
texts.en:
Mrs Catarina is married and the mother of 5 children who are all in her care. Her husband is a coal merchant. Of her children, one isn't old enough to go to school yet, but the rest attend school.

With this loan she plans to buy beers, soda, meats, beans, rice and olive oil to sell in her small stall, but her dream is to build a grocery store to provide almost every type of 'necessity' product to the members of her community.

Even though she faces financial difficulties, her challenge is to pay back the loan in the agreed amount of time.

loans.use: buy beers, soda, meats, beans, rice and olive oil to sell in her small stall

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
A senhora Albertina é solteira, mae de 01 filho que frequenta o ensino superior. Ela é que toma conta do filho e da despesa de casa. O emprestimo pretende comprar cimento e area para fabrico de blocos e revender, pois, está a residir numa zona em expansão e com necessidade daquele tipo de material.
O sonho dela é ter um estaleiro bem recheiado e com todo o tipo de material de construçao desde a area, cimento, varroes ate as tijoleiras. Pese embora, enfrenta dificuldades financeiras, o seu desafio é reembolsar o credito dentro do tempo acordado
texts.en:
Mrs Albertina is single and the mother of 1 son who goes to college. She is the one who takes care of her son and the household expenses. 

With this loan she plans to buy sand to make bricks for resale as she is in an area which is currently expanding and in need of this kind of material.

Her dream is to have a hardware shop filled with all types of construction material such as sand, cement, rods and even tiles. Even though she faces financial difficulties, her challenge will be to pay back the loan within the agreed amount of time.

loans.use: buy sand to make bricks for resale

loans.name: Candida

texts.pt:
A sra Candida tem 47 anos, viúva e mãe de seis filhos que estão na sua responsabilidade. O  seu esposo morreu na mina de carvão na África do Sul deixando-a com seis filhos que frequentam o ensino primário e secundário, respectivamente.
Com o empréstimo, pretende comprar cervejas, refrigerantes, carnes para revender no seu quiosque, porém, o seu sonho é construir um talho para fornecer carne aos residentes da sua comunidade.
Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, o seu desafio é reembolsar o crédito dentro do prazo acordado
texts.en:
Mrs Candida is 47 years old, a widow and the mother of 6 children who are all in her care. Her husband died in a coal mine in South Africa, leaving her with 6 children who go to primary school and high school.

With this loan she plans to buy beers, soda and meats to sell in her small stall, but her dream is to build a butchers shop to provide meat for the members of her community.

Even though she faces financial difficulties, her challenge is to pay back the loan within the agreed amount of time.

loans.use: buy beers, soda and meats for resale in her small stall

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
A senhora Fatima é solteira. Vive com 05 irmaos e todos estao na sua responsabilidade.para alem dos seus irmaos, cuida da sua mae que vive numa outra provincia..
 Com o emprestimo pretende comprar pintos, vitaminas e raçao para a criaçao de frangos e posteriormente vender aos residentes do seu bairro e outros. O seu sonho é ter uma viatura para a facilitar nas deslocações do seu negocio e o desafio é reembolsar o emprestimo.
texts.en:
Ms Fatima is single. She lives with her 5 siblings who are all under her care. As well as her siblings, she looks after her mother who lives in another province.

With this loan she will buy chicks, vitamins and rations to breed chickens to sell to the residents of her neighbourhood and further afield.

Her dream is to have a vehicle to facilitate moving from place to place for her business and her challenge is to pay back her loan.

loans.use: buy chicks, vitamins and rations to breed chickens

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman who lives with her husband and four children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, Mary has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a cloth selling business in Likoni town. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Maria Bernarda

texts.es:
María Bernarda es una mujer de 42 años de edad, bien vestida que con lo poco que tiene se preocupa por lucir bien y dar una buena apariencia a sus clientes para vender alguno de sus productos que precisamente son prendas de vestir muy enfocada en las prendas para dama.
Es una mujer casada, madre de 3 hijos de 11, 7 y 5 años de edad, una gran responsabilidad que acarrea grandes gastos, y esta es una de las razones por las cuales sale diariamente a la calle a buscar quien le compre una prenda pues la necesidad es grande. 
Su mayor preocupación es la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos, y todas sus ganancias son destinadas para ello, quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, y todo ello pues lo hará vendiendo más.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa para dama como Blue jean, blusas, abrigos y accesorios para dama, su idea es salir a pueblos y mostrar su mercancía, crear alianzas que le compren cada mes.
texts.en:
Maria Bernarda, 42 years old, is a well-dressed woman. Within her limited means, she takes care to look good and present a nice appearance to her clients so that she can sell her products, which are precisely clothing items very focused on women's fashion.

She's married and the mother of three children aged 11, seven, and five. This is a great responsibility involving large expenses, and it is one of the reasons why she goes out on the street every day looking for buyers, since great is the need.

Her biggest concern is feeding and educating her children, and all her income is aimed at covering these expenses. She also wants to improve the condition of her home, and she will accomplish all this through increased sales.

Maria Bernarda is requesting the loan to purchase a variety of women's clothing, such as blue jeans, blouses, coats, and accessories.

Her idea is going out to the towns to show her merchandise, and establish alliances to encourage monthly sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of women's clothing such as blue jeans, blouses, coats and accessories.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Hello wonderful Kiva lenders! Here is Steven, a young and energetic farmer, living in the rich highland area of Kapsowar. 

Steven has been doing farming for three years. He produces and sells milk and eggs, which he gets from his farm; he also has a “side hustle” business. His main hobby in farming is sheep farming. Steven has a passion for keeping sheep but one problem he faces is a lack of capital to increase his sheep stock. 

Steven is kindly requesting a loan to buy a sheep. Through the loan, he will be able to get meat (mutton) and wool that fetch high prices in both local and international markets. Through this loan, the life of Stephen will change because he will give his children a good education through paying their school fees from income from the sheep.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of sheep

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa, de 62 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 7 ya están acompañados.

Felipa, desde muy joven aprendió acerca de la ganadería, ya que su padre lo realizaba.
 
Felipa, decidió solicitar el crédito para comprar 2 vacas lecheras, las cuales serán un fuente de ingresos más.

A futuro sueña con tener más ganado para la producción de cuajada, mantequilla, leche y quesos; para un mayor ingreso económico a su hogar.
texts.en:
Felipa, 62, is in a relationship and her partner works with cattle. She has 8 children, of whom 7 are already in relationships.

From a young age, Felipa learned about cattle because her father worked in this field. She has decided to apply for a loan to buy two milk cows, which will provide an additional source of income. 

In the future, she dreams of having more cattle to make cheese curd, butter, milk, and cheese, to improve her household's financial income.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows.

loans.name: Gregorio De La Paz

texts.es:
Gregorio, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero y es padre de 2 hijos, quienes ya formaron su propio hogar.
 
Gregorio, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 2 años de ejercer este trabajo, lo hace desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:00 de la tarde.

Necesita el crédito para comprar 8 fardos de ropa usada, en buen estado.- Ademas, piensa comprar zapatos para surtir más su negocio. 

A futuro sueña con comprar un local donde pueda lucir y exhibir su ropa.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 41, studied up until the ninth grade. He is single and is a father of two children, who already have their own homes.

Gregorio has made a living selling clothing for two years. He works from 7:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. 

He needs this loan to buy eight packages of used clothing in good condition. He is also thinking of buying footwear to stock his business even more. 

In the future, he dreams of buying a business property where he can exhibit and display his clothing.

loans.use: to buy eight packages of used clothing in good condition.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen is a villager of Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. Aged 58, Nen is married with six children. Two of the children are still living with her and among them one is still in secondary school. 

For 40 years, Nen has been growing cassava for sale. She also owns a rice farm. Nen is a new member with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is requesting a 3,000,000 KHR loan to buy cassava stems and fertilizer for her cassava plantation. She also wishes buy a new piece land for the plantation.

loans.use: to buy cassava stems and fertilizer

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a 22-year-old from a village near Ramallah city. He opened a store selling car accessories two years ago. He loves this field and he tries to bring the latest collection of car accessories to his clients. 

Yasin took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of accessories for his store. This will improve his business and also increase his income. 

Yasin appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of car accessories for his store.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is from Vinogradovo. She is a widow with two kids who are 15 and 19 years old. Her husband died when he was abroad working and earning money to feed the family. It was a big tragedy for the family. 

Ganna had two young kids to raise and provide for. However, she didn't give up and started a business along with her sister. Later, she became an independent entrepreneur.  Ganna sells women's clothing in the local marketplace. Ganna works all by herself without hired employees. She has been running this business for the last four years. 
 
Ganna is seeking 10,000 Grivnyas to restock her merchandise with light sweaters, shirts and pants for the upcoming spring season and promote her vending location through that.

loans.use: to restock her merchandise with light sweaters, shirts and pants for the upcoming spring season

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a farmer from Podstepnoye. She is a widow with a teenage daughter. Natalya owns a piece of land – 53 ares where she has been growing early cucumbers, squash, peppers, eggplant and greens for the last six years. 

Natalya needs to prepare her greenhouses for the upcoming season, which is why she needs an additional 15,000 Grivnyas to buy plastic film and coal, as well as to reconstruct one of the greenhouses that needs it this spring.

loans.use: to buy plastic film and coal, as well as to reconstruct one of the greenhouses that needs it this spring

loans.name: Sumaj Wayra-33 Group

texts.es:
Rocsana es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 5 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 11 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de pan.
Su negocio lo desarrolla en un mercado de la localidad de Sacaba un área rural caracterizada por mantenerse como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, hasta en los distritos urbanos. De clima cálido semi-tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 12-28 grados centígrados.
Rocsana es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie, en la fila de atrás, usa blusa blanca la primera de la derecha). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Sus sueños por mejorar sus ingresos económicos la llevaron a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; tapicería, venta de comida, venta de papa, transporte libre, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos por catálogo y venta de desayunos para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de pan; ella se ocupa de repartir la variedad de panes que le deja el panadero, ocupación que realiza 3 veces al día porque la venta se realiza de esa manera. Su vena la realiza en un puesto de venta a la intemperie dentro del mercado, sus clientes son constantes y diarios. “comencé mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar, mis hijos me colaboran transportando el pan desde la panadería, algunas veces el panadero se atrasa y los clientes hacen fila hasta que llegue el pan…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante grande donde tener empleado y poder descansar, ella desea aumentar el volumen y variedad de pan, realizando la compra de pan a 2 panaderos para aumentar su oferta y pagar los gastos diarios de sus hijos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rocsana solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de pan para aumentar su volumen de ventas y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rocsana is a 32 year old woman. She lives with her husband and has a son who is 5 years old and two daughters who are 10 and 11. She has a business selling bread. She developed her business in a market in the town of Sacaba, a rural area characterized by its role as the granary of the city because of its production of cereals, vegetables and fruits even in the urban districts. It has a warmsemi-tropical climate with temperatures that vary during the day between 12-28 degrees C. 

Rocsana has brown skin, she is short and she has long black hair that she keeps in a pony tail. She has dark eyes, a robust physique and her native language is Quechua which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish as part of the wider culture and the sales that she completes. (In the photo she is standing in the back row wearing a white blouse. She is the first on the right). She shares her life with her husband who works in construction, and with her children who study in school. They live in a rented room constructed out of adobe with a corrugated iron roof and access to well water and electricity. She dreams of increasing her earnings led her to join a bank of people with businesses such as: upholstery, food sales, potato sales, hired transportation, clothing sales, cosmetics sales via catalogue and the sale of breakfasts. They are seeking a loan to meet their goals. 

Rocsana has a business selling bread. She takes care of distributing the variety of breads that the baker leaves her. This is a job that she does 3 times per day because this is the way she completes her sales. The baker's work  is completed in a stall in the open market. Rocsana's clients are constant and come every day. "I began my business out of the need to work. My children help me to transport the bread from the bakery. Sometimes the baker is late and the customers make a line until the bread arrives..." she told us. Her dream is to open a big restaurant where she could have employees and be able to rest. She is seeking to increase the volume and variety of bread by completing the purchase of bread from 2 bakers to increase her offerings and to pay for the daily expenses of her children. This is the 2nd sequence of loans with this institution over 10 years that she has completed for this activity. Based on these motives, Rocsana is seeking a loan to purchase a variety of breads to increase her volume of sales and pay for the expenses associated with her children.


Es por esos motivos que Rocsana solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de pan para aumentar su volumen de ventas y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of breads to increase her volume of sales and pay for the expenses associated with her children.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and comes from Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao.  She is a single mom to her daughter, Dainty Claire. She provides for her through her tutoring services to kids which is sometimes insufficient, especially now that Dainty Claire is in college. Dainty is taking up a BS in Accountancy which she chose because she believes that this will help her to achieve a better future. 

To help send her daughter to school, Grace wants to access an education loan of PHP150,000.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, no pudo asistir a una escuela, está casada y su esposo es agricultor y ganadero, tienen 10 hijos, 5 de ellos viven en casa, 4 trabajan y solo la menor estudia sexto grado y los demás trabajan con su padre.  

María, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y además compra ganado para luego venderlo, este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, ya que él se ha dedicado a este negocio desde su adolescencia, el ganado lo cuida y lo maneja en un terreno frente a su propiedad. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ganado, específicamente terneritas para crecerlas y luego venderlas cuando estén más grandes y otras para crecerlas y reproducirlas; el negocio le genera buenas ganancias, ya que se han dedicado por varios años y tiene mucha experiencia. 

El sueño de María es tener buena salud para poder seguir comercializando con el ganado y ayudar a su hija menor para que estudie hasta donde ella quiera.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old. She wasn't able to go to school. She is married and her husband is a farmer and a cattle rancher. They have 10 children. Five of them live at home and four work. Only the youngest is in school, sixth grade. The rest of them work with their father.  

María does the housework and also buys cattle to later sell. She learned this business from her husband, since he worked in this business since his adolescence. She cares for the cattle and manages it on some land in the front part of her property.

She needs the loan to buy cattle. specifically heifers to raise and then sell when they are bigger. Others she will raise and breed. The business generates profits for her, since she has done this for several years and has a lot of experience.  

María's dream is to have good health to be able to keep selling cattle and helping her youngest daughter go to school as long as she wants.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 50-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small agricultural center near Mount Elgon (17th highest in Africa). 

He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with eight children. 

On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown bananas for 15 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a side hustle business to supplement the meager income they earn from farming. 

From Kiva lenders, Nicholas is seeking a loan worth KES 65,000 to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Nicholas access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Nicholas’ family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ella es Ana una mujer de 57 años de edad que desea iniciar un negocio de venta de ganando porcino, las razones es que en su hogar que lo conforman 3 hijos y sus nietos estan pasando necesidades y cansada de esto busco una alternativa que le permita desempeñarse como madre, abuela y empresaria. 
Gracias a su madre tiene los conocimientos para empezar el negocio, conoce como debe asearlos, alimentarlos, engordarlos etc.
Su objetivo más marcado es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y con el apoyo solicitado comprara cerdos y alimento esperando a tener éxito y salir de la difícil situación que se encuentra ahora y pensando en que esta sea le medio de sostenimiento de su familia por muchos años.
texts.en:
Ana is a 57-year-old woman who wants to start up a pig-selling business. She is doing this because her household, comprised of 3 children and her grandchildren, is currently in need. She has had enough of this so she is searching for an alternative that will allow her to play the role of mother, grandmother and businesswoman. 

Thanks to her mother she has the appropriate knowledge to start the business: she knows how to clean the pigs, feed them, fatten them up, etc. Her main objective is to be able to improve the conditions of her household. With the loan she has requested she will buy pigs and pig feed. She hopes to be successful and get out of the difficult situation in which she currently finds herself. She thinks that this will be a way to support her family for many years.

loans.use: to start up her pig-breeding business by buying pigs, building a shelter, and buying pig food

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, de 49 años de edad, es jornalero, no estudio porque su familia no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos, para poder darle estudio, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, su pareja se dedica a los que haceres del hogar.

Pedro, trabaja cortando caña y también se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace varios años, decidió aprenderlo por la misma necesidad económica que tenían, para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos; para llegar a su trabajo viaja en moto 5 kilómetros y su horario es de 5:00 a.m. a 12:00 del mediodía todos los días.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución es para comprar una novilla, la cual en un tiempo determinado le dará leche y así obtendrá un poco de ingresos extras, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Pedro, es comprar una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 49 years old. He is a day laborer. He didn't go to school because his family didn't have enough financial resources to give him an education. He is married and has 3 grown children. His spouse takes care of the home. 

Pedro works cutting sugarcane. He has also worked as an artisanal fisherman for several years. He decided to learn about it out of the same financial need that they had, so he could cover his children's needs. In order to get to his job he travels 5 kilometers in motorcycle and his schedule is from 5:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon every day. 

The loan he is asking for in the institution is to buy a heifer. After a certain time, it will produce milk and that way he can obtain extra income to give his family a better quality of life. 

Pedro's dream is to buy a worthy home for his family.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Kri's Group

texts.en:
Age 35, Kri is married with six children. Four of her children are living with her and her husband in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. For 14 years, Kri has been growing cassava to make an income. She is also a paid-worker when she needs more money. 

This is Kri's sixth time being a member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is leading her group of three. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to hire workers to work on her cassava plantation. She hopes to expand her land and to grow some other crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to hire workers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Ret is a villager from Memot district, Kampong Cham province. 54 years of age, Ret is a widow with five children. One of her children is living with her and he is a worker at a local rubber plantation. 

Ret has been planting cassava for 10 years and she can earn around 7 USD per day. Ret has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, once before. The former loan allowed her plantation to have a higher yield. As the leader of her group, which consists of two members, Ret is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 KHR for her cassava plantation. The loan will be divided to hire workers to plough and take care of the plantation, and to buy fertilizer and herbicide. She wishes for her cassava plantation to be even more productive so that she can buy another piece of land for growing cassava.

loans.use: to hire workers to plough and take care of the plantation, and to buy fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Nii Nii Baa Hi Le 2 Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Nii Nii Baa Hi Le 2, and they are on their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses run by the members include tea, rice and stew, groceries, porridge, kenkey and fish, stationary, ornaments and jewelries. The loan that they will receive will benefit their micro-businesses. 

This is Abigail's second year with ID-Ghana. She joined by invitation from her sister, who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling tea, rice and stew. She began this business on her own effort about four years ago. 

The loan that Abigail has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase milk, Milo, rice and other ingredients to prepare tea, rice and stew, which she will sell to customers. She will purchase the products from the market and later sell them at her residence. 

This job allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married with one dependent child. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are responsible, which has helped them very much.

loans.use: to purchase milk, Milo, rice and other ingredients to prepare tea, rice and stew, which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a small village of Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham province, 43-year-old Yom is married with eight children; five of them are living with her. 

For 23 years, Yom has been planting cassava and being a paid worker to support the family finances. She is able to earn around $7 USD daily. 

For her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and as the leader of her group, Yom is pursuing a loan of 150,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation. Seeing that the previous loans improved her living conditions, she hopes that the current loan will further improve their financial status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Keang's Group

texts.en:
An elderly mother of eight, Keang is residing in a small village of Cheung Prey District of Kampong Cham province with her husband and four of her children. Two of her children are still studying in secondary school. 

For 35 years, Keang has been growing rice with her husband to support the family. Her two children also help with the family budget by being factory workers. 

This is her first time borrowing from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is the leader of her group that is made up of two people and is applying for a 900,000 KHR loan to repair her house. She hopes to have a better and more hygienic living space for her family.

loans.use: to repair her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is from Podstepnoye. He is 47 and married with a son. He has a greenhouse business. Sergei has been running this business for more than 21 years. He grows early and late cucumbers and squash on his land lot of 55 ares. 

Sergei needs 17,000 Grivnyas to reconstruct existing greenhouses and prepare them for the spring season. Sergei is determined to maintain his greenhouse business that feeds his whole family and provides for their needs. He is willing to grow his farming endeavor, adding new greenhouses as soon as his income allows expansion.

loans.use: to reconstruct existing greenhouses and prepare them for the spring season

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives and runs her business in Zaporozhye. She works at one of the biggest local markets selling women's clothing merchandise, mostly sportswear, coats and jackets.
