All her clothing merchandise is of very high quality and stylish. Svetlana has owned her vending facilities since 2005, which helps her save considerably on renting expenses. Svetlana's individual approach to each client helps her build a loyal clientele and find new customers as well.  

Svetlana needs 32 000 UAH to buy light women's jackets, sweatsuits, and down jackets for early spring. Svetlana is planning to re-invest a portion of her income to further develop her business while using some of that amount to meet her family's personal needs.

loans.use: to buy light women's jackets, sweatsuits, and down jackets for early spring.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children. 

Cheryl has owned and managed a sari-sari (variety) store business for two years, and it really helps her family with their living. Cheryl and her husband help each other to manage their sari-sari store. 

Cheryl joined and became a member of GDMPC in 2003. She decided to borrow again, requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store. In this way, her store inventory and sales will increase, earning more income. 

Cheryl plans for the future are to expand her business to generate more income, so that through her business she can provide a continuous education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El tiene un pequeño taller donde se dedica a la soldadura de estructuras metálicas y al manejo de mototaxi, trasladando a pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, es un padre emprendedor y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de herramientas que utiliza para soldar y de esta manera implementar su negocio, con esto José Carlos espera atender con mayor facilidad a sus clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: José Carlos is 28 years old. He lives together with his wife and his son in the district of Cayaltí, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock located in the Chiclayo province that is part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú. He has a small shop where he works welding metal structures and he drives a mototaxi, taking passengers to the farmhouses in the district. He is an entrepreneurial father and he has many good personal and work references in the region. He has sought a loan to purchase the tools that he uses to weld so he can conduct his business. With this loan José Carlos hopes to have an easier time attending to his clients and to provide them with better service which will have a positive impact on his level of earnings and will allow him to improve he and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase the tools that he uses to weld so that he can conduct his business.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
Javier, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a los recursos económicos en que vivían, esta casado y junto con su esposa tienen 2 hijos, de 8 y 3 años de edad, su esposa se dedica al cuido de sus hijos y a los quehaceres del hogar.

Javier, trabaja como lanchero desde hace 15 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padrastro, para llegar a su trabajo tiene que recorrer 3 kilómetros y trabaja en el horario de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución es para comprar una motocicleta, para poder trasladarse hacia su trabajo.

El sueño de Javier es, tener una casa grande para su familia.
texts.en:
Javier is 32 years old and studied up to fourth grade, when he had to quit school based on the economic situation he lived in. He is married and together with his wife has 2 sons, ages 8 and 3. His wife takes care of the children and household responsibilities.

Javier, has been working as a boatman for the last 15 years, a job he learned from his stepfather. He has to cover 3 kilometers to get to where he works, and his hours are from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

The loan he is requesting from our institution will be used to buy a motorcycle that he can use to go back and forth from work. 

Javier’s dream is to have a big house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng is a 32 year-old married woman who is a resident of a rural village of Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. She has four children who are primary and secondary students. 

To make a living, Sreng has been planting cassava for 14 years besides doing rice farming. Sreng has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for eight cycles now and she is seeking a loan for her cassava plantation. She intends to spend it on hiring workers to work on the field and to buy fertilizer.

Sreng hopes that her cassava plantation will be fruitful so that she can keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to hire workers to work on her cassava field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund is thankful that he was granted an 8,000 PHP loan that he used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help in the education of his children and in their personal and household needs. 

He would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy tires and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. It is important that his tricycle is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his transport business.

Edmund hopes to buy additional tricycle unit to improve his income. He dreams to give his family a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tires, maintenance and gas for his tricycle service.

loans.name: Neat's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Ou Reang Ov district, Kampong Cham province, Neat is 61 years old and married with eight children. All of her children have already formed their own families and moved to live away. 

Her primary sources of income are from farming rice and crafting when she is free. She has been doing that two work for 43 years. She manages to save $5 USD for saving daily. 

Neat has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, one time before. Leading her group of two, Neat is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR for her rice farm. She will buy potash and rice seed for it. She hopes that her rice will produce a higher yield so that she can build a house.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
A 54-year-old widow, Rin is living in Memot district of Kampong Cham province with two of her four children. One of the two children living with her is still a secondary student. To manage the family budget, Rin has been growing cassava for sale for eight years. She can earn roughly 5 USD every day. 

This is her fifth time being a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and now a leader of her group of three. Rin is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to hire workers to plough and work on the plantation, and to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and cassava stems. She wishes for her plantation to be productive so that she can build a new house from the profit.

loans.use: to hire workers to plough and work on the plantation, and to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and cassava stems

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, Nat is a 33 year-old married woman with three school-aged children. 

Nat has been a rice farmer for 14 years, in order to finance her family. She also helps the villagers to harvest their crops for extra income. She is able to save 5 USD each day. 

This is Nat's sixth cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 400,000 KHR in order to buy potash and rice seed from her farm. She hopes that the profit from her harvest will allow her to buy a motorbike to travel around.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokleang's Group

texts.en:
Sokleang is 43 years old and married with four children. All of them are living in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. Her family's primary source of income is from fishing, and has been for 25 years. Some of her children are factory workers in order to contribute to the family budget.  

This is her first time being a member with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sokleang is leading her group to apply for a loan of 900,000 KHR for both of them. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy fishing equipment. She hopes that they can get more fish, which means more income.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 44. She is married with two twin daughters. Margarita is from Khoost, and she has been working in a wedding store for four years. Her creative personality helps her make money using her talents: Margarita makes and sells bridal and wedding accessories. 

Margarita is seeking 40,000 UAH (Ukrainian hryvnias) to stucco her private house, which has been in her plans for the last few years. Her house looks terrible on the outside due to flooding this region had to face back in 2001. It took Margarita 14 years to work out all the details and find a source of additional funding to finally make her dream come true.

loans.use: to stucco her private house

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is 36. He is married with a child. Sergei has worked as an entrepreneur for over 10 years now. He lives in Zaporozhye and owns a few vending facilities at two different marketplaces. All his vending stalls are in excellent condition and stacked with diversified merchandise. 

Sergei is very happy to actually own his vending facilities because now it's a lot easier for him to control his merchandise and hired employees. Sergei decided to stick to a variety of small items in his selection of goods because they always sell well and give him a stable turnover.
 
Sergei is hoping to invest 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional clasp knives, gift knives and sets, flashlights, lighters, key chains, batteries, electric radios, bulbs, etc.  

Sergei is very prudent. Within time, he is planning to find a good salesperson for the vending location where he is in charge to lessen his workload and be able to expand his trade.

loans.use: to purchase additional clasp knives, gift knives and sets, flashlights, lighters, key chains, batteries, electric radios, bulbs, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-years-old married man from Gaza city. He had a home where he was living with his wife and kids, but it has been destroyed during the last violence on Gaza. Mohammad works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family needs.

Mohammad needs to repair his house urgently but he does not have enough money, so he came to FATEN and requested a USD Murabaha loan. This loan will help him to repair his house after the last violence on Gaza. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide a safe and warm home for his kids.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to repair his house after the last violence on Gaza.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, makeup and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 6 años, 9 años y 11 años de  edad. María se dedica a la venta de pan francés desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de  mayor cantidad de pan francés y canastos para la venta. De esta forma espera mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: María is 31-years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children, who are 6-, 9-, and 11-years old respectively.  María has made her living for a long time selling french bread.  It allows her to support her household.  She is requesting a loan from FUSAI out of a desire to improve her standard of living.  She will invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of french bread and baskets to use  for making her sales.  María hopes this will improve her sales and her income, which will give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of french bread and baskets to use for making her sales.

loans.name: Keneth Joy

texts.en:
Keneth Joy is a 45-year-old married woman from Merida, Leyte. She has three grownup children. 

In the picture, Keneth Joy is standing next to a newly renovated sari-sari store. She would like to receive a loan to buy stock of items like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking condiments and others. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Keneth Joy hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy stock of items like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking condiments and others.

loans.name: Maria Corazon

texts.es:
Maria tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de peluquería contando con herramientas propias, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de productos de belleza, muebles y espejos para la implementacion de su peluquería, dicha inversión le servirá para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old and is a single mother.  She lives with her son in the district of Nueva Arica, in a rural zone that is located in the Province of Chiclayo, the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.  Life in her community is calm.  Residents work in agriculture and raising animals. 

Maria works offering hair salon services and has her own equipment.  Her business is located in her home.  She has more than 3 years of experience in the business and has regular clients that provide her with good personal and work references.  

She is asking for a loan in order to buy beauty care products, furniture, and mirrors for her salon.  This investment will help her to offer better service to her customers and will allow her to increase her income and thus the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty care products, furniture, and mirrors for her salon.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, de 56 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos.

Andrés, tiene 35 años de experiencia en los trabajos de agricultura y ganadería, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes lo educaron y le inculcaron buenos principios.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado y cerdos, decidió comprarlos porque está a buen precio, el ganado y los cerdos, serán sometidos a un control de saneamiento, para luego ser puesto a la venta, de esta manera  podrá obtener un mejor ingreso.

Andrés, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria, también desea reparar las instalaciones donde reposa y descansan sus animales.
texts.en:
Andrés, aged 56, works in farming and ranching. He is married and lives with his spouse and three children.

Andrés has 35 years of experience in farming, which he learned from his parents, who taught him and instilled in him good principles.

The money from the loan will be used to buy cattle and pigs, which he decided to buy because of their good price. He will assess and monitor their health, before then selling them on, which will increase his income.

Andrés' dream is to see his children graduate with university degrees, and also wishes to repair the buildings in which his animals sleep.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 28 years old, a wife, and a mother of a small child who has not started school yet. They are living in the Sambour district of Kratie province.

Chanthy has been a rice farmer for five years in order to manage the family budget. She can keep roughly 5 USD of savings each day. As a new member with Kiva’s partner, VisonFund, and a leader of her group, Chanthy is applying for a 4,000,000 KHR loan to buy good quality rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. She expects that she can earn more profit from her farm and that her family can be better fed.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Sara Nohemy

texts.es:
Sara, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con su madre, la cual depende de ella y también vive con su hermano, el cual trabaja para sus propios gastos.

Sara, trabaja como empleada en un restaurante en la playa desde hace 9 años, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo, para ayudarle a su mamá en los gastos de la casa.- Para llegar a su trabajo viaja en trasporte que la empresa le proporciona y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

El crédito que esta solicitando en credicampo, es para compra lámina, cemento, hierro y arena para poder ampliar un poco más su vivienda.

El sueño de Sara, es comprar una vivienda digna y grande para su mamá y ella.
texts.en:
Sara is 29 years old and studied through high school.  She is single and does not have children.  She lives with her mother, who depends on her income. She also lives with her brother, who works to cover his own expenses.  

Sara works as an employee in a restaurant located on the beach and has been working there for 9 years.  She decided to dedicate herself to this work in order to help her mother with household expenses.  To get to work she takes transportation provided by the business and her schedule is from 6am to 5pm.  

She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Credicampo in order to purchase metal sheets, cement, iron and sand in order to add on to her home.  Sara's dream is to buy a dignified and larger home for herself and her mother.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets, cement, iron and sand in order to add on to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un señor de 32 años de edad es casado tienen una linda familia de 3 hijos tres hombres y una mujer de las edades de entre 4 y 12 años.
Daniel es un padre de familia que ama a sus hijos y  para que no les falte nada él trabaja con dedicación y esmero, como albañil el tienen 4 años de ejercer esta profesión, gracias a este trabajo el a logrado sacar a delante a su familia, pero Daniel no es un hombre conformista es por eso que  también se dedica a la agricultura para obtener otro ingreso, Daniel con el bajo recurso que tenia cuando construyo su casa no pudo instalarle la energía eléctrica es por eso que desde hace algunos años no tiene energía eléctrica entonces ahora él se ve a la necesidad de este servicio, porque a sus hijos les sirve porque ellos están estudiando, pero una de las limitaciones de Daniel es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para solicitar es te servicio, es por eso que junto a su esposa se han decidido solicita un prestamo que lo utilizar para pagar la instalación de la luz eléctrica en su vivienda.
Daniel tiene las esperanzas de poder contar con este crédito para que su familia ya no  parezca de necesidades de la luz eléctrica.
texts.en: Daniel is 32 years old. He is married and he has a beautiful family of three sons and a daughter who are between 4 and 12 years old. Daniel is the father in a family that loves its children and, so they are not lacking in anything, he works with dedication and care as a mason. He has worked in this profession for 4 years and thanks to this work he has been able to get his family ahead. However, Daniel is not a conformist man and because of this he also works in agriculture to make other earnings. Because of the little resources he had when he constructed his home he was not able to install electricity and it is because of this that for several years they have not had electricity. Now he sees the need for this service because it will help his children who are studying. However, one of the limitations Daniel faces is that he does not have enough money to order this service. It is because of this situation that he, together with his wife, decided to seek a loan to use to pay for the installation of electricity in his home. Daniel hopes that he can count on this loan so that his family can get the electricity it needs.

loans.use: to pay to install electricity.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Thiry-two-year-old Van is married with two young children. They are living in a rural village of Sambour district, Kratie province. Her main source of income is from operating a small grocery store at home, and she can save around $5 USD every day. 

This is her first time being a member with VisonFund, Kiva’s partner. She is the leader of her group, and she is pursuing a 1,400,000 KHR loan to buy stock for her grocery shop. She hopes that her business will run well and be more profitable.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery shop

loans.name: Rakho Bibi

texts.en:
Rakho Bibi is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family, and he has been running his own fabric business for the past five years.
 
Rakho Bibi's husband wants to purchase different types of fabric for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these things. Therefore, Rakho Bibi applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more profitable income and manage his business and household. Rakho bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of fabric for her husband to increase his business.

loans.name: Davy's Group

texts.en:
A young man at the age of 21, Davy, is a resident in a rural village of Kratie province. He is a security guard and it earns him 6 USD a day. 

This is his first time being a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and as the leader of his group, Davy is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. He plans to buy a motorcycle with that money. He hopes that it will assist his travelling and cut down motor taxi expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Soktheng's Group

texts.en:
Soktheng is 38 years old and married with three children. Only two of them are her dependents. They are living in a rural village of Kratie district of Kratie province.

To earn a living, she has been growing corn for the past twenty years. She manages to save approximately 7 USD every day for future uses.

Soktheng is new with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is a leader of her group that contains three members. She is requesting a 1,400,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer for her corn farm.

She hopes that her plantation will be productive so that she can keep sending her children to school until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man from Gaza City. He had a home where he was living with his wife and kids, but it has been destroyed during the last violence in Gaza.

Ahmad works as an employee in a local firm, where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family’s needs.

Ahmad needs to repair his house urgently, but he does not have enough money. So, he came to FATEN and requested a USD Murabaha loan. This loan will help him to repair his house after the last violence in Gaza. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to provide a safe and warm home for his kids.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to repair his house after the last violence in Gaza.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase adobe, corrugated iron, and other materials, in order to build a larger kitchen where she can prepare foods for sale.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada de material semi rústico. El domicilio de Alcides se ubica en el distrito de Pucará, en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que desempeña Alcides es la de prestar servicio de transporte urbano en su unidad vehicular cubriendo la ruta a las ciudades de JAEN – PUCARA en el departamento de Cajamarca, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Alcides solicita el préstamo para invertir en realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con lo que podrá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo para poder seguir generando ingresos para su subsistencia y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alcides is 41 years old. He lives in a rented house made of partially-rustic materials. His home is located in the district of Pucará in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region, which is in the northern mountains of Peru. The community in which he lives is a small rural area, where the residents are dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and business.

The activity Alcides pursues is offering urban transportation services in vehicle, covering the route from the cities of Jaen and Pucara in the department of Cajamarca. He has experience in this field and has very good personal and professional references in the area. 

Alcides requests the loan to invest in making repairs and maintaining his vehicle, since it is currently in a poor state. With this, he will be able to ensure that his vehicle functions properly, so that he can continue earning income for surviving and so that he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs and to maintain his vehicle, which is currently in a poor state.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is working hard for the betterment of their lives. She believes that she will be able to change their current status with the help of her requested loan.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feeds and vaccines for raising hogs.

Aside from hog raising, she also earns money by washing clothes. Her husband is a driver. The income they generate goes toward their daily household expenditures.

Jovita really hopes to obtain the loan amount requested.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vaccines needed for raising pigs

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is thankful that previously she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her rag-making business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Gemma would like to apply for a loan of PHP 20,000 which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed to sew rags to sell. Her round, palm-sized rags are useful in cleaning cabinets and kitchen counters; they are a major item for housekeeping and cleaning, and are changed constantly to ensure a bacteria free rag. 

Gemma also sells native rice cakes for additional income. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help in their daily sustenance and for the schooling of her children.

Gemma hopes to sustain and grow her businesses so that she can send all her children to college allowing them better opportunities in life. Her dream is to give her family a better life through all of her hard work. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials such as fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Danita

texts.en:
Danita is thankful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, detergents, coffee and other personal care products to sell. Her earnings helped a lot in their daily needs.

She would now like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of skin and beauty products, undergarments, footwear and cleaning agents to meet her regular customers' advanced orders. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund her family's personal and household needs.

Danita dreams to be a famous networking dealer. She prays to be more successful and lead a healthy and abundant life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy beauty, cosmetic, and personal products to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is thankful that she was granted a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and supplies, and for the maintenance of her shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy more spare parts and for the maintenance of her welding shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial aid that will be given her.

Mercedes dreams to have her own place for her welding shop. She desires that all her children will go to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and supplies needed for her welding shop business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single woman who has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over two years, Mariam has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000 Mariam wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat

loans.name: Grupo Franciscana Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una señora de 39 años de edad es casa tienen una familia hermosa de dos hijos con las edades de entre 5 y 8 años, vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Francisca (la primera del lado derecho de blusa negra) es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, ella para generar sus ingresos se dedica la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, ella vende güipiles blusas fajas y todo lo relacionado con trajes típicos, francisca se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 2 años y con los ingresos que obtiene apoya a su esposo al mantenimiento de la casa.
Francisca es una mujer con una visión positiva con sueños grandes, ella  con el paso del tiempo ha ido mejorando su negocio pero lo que Francisca quiere ahora es mejor la calidad de sus servicios y ampliar su negocio pero una de las dificultades que Francisca tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo es por eso que tomo la decisión de unirse a un grupo de mujeres con la misma actividad para solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizaran para comprar nuevos estilos de cortes, blusas, fajas y rebosos, pues ahora el mundo se encuentra muy cambiante con los estilos.
El sueño de francisca y su grupo es  poder optar a este crédito para realizar la inversión y obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 39 year old woman and she has a beautiful family made up of two children ages 5 and 8.  She lives in the community of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  

Francisca (the first on the right hand side in the black blouse) is a very hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family.  She makes money by purchasing and selling traditional clothing from her region.  She sells traditional dresses (güipiles), blouses, girdles/corsets (fajas), and other items associated with traditional dress.  Francisca has been working in this field for two years and with her income she is able to support her husband in maintaining their home. 

Francisca is a woman with a positive outlook and big dreams.   She has been improving her business over time, but what she wants now is to improve the quality of her services and to grow her business, but one of the challenges that she faces is that she does not have sufficient capital to be able to do it.  For this reason she decided to join a group of women who work in this same field in order to request a loan that she will use to purchase new styles of cuts, blouses, corsets, and shawls.  The world is very interesting in new and different styles.  Francisca's dream and that of her group is to be able to get this loan in order to invest in her business and obtain better income.

loans.use: To purchase different types of traditional clothing for resale.

loans.name: Musarrat Bibi

texts.en:
Musarrat Bibi is a 35-year-old woman and mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a bakery. He sells different types of edible items, e.g., cakes, biscuits, pastries, etc. He is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Musarrat Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Musarrat Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his bakery business with the purchase of edible items

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Ayawavi est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans qui vit avec son mari et ses six enfants à Lomé. Ayawavi vend des tapettes dans son quartier et arrive à subvenir favorablement à ses besoins. Ayawavi s’approvisionne au marché d’Akodessewa deux fois par mois pour avoir en permanence son stock. Pour avoir une nouvelle commande de tapettes Ayawavi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter de nouvelles tapettes et présenter de  bonnes gammes à ses clients et réaliser plus de bénéfice pour aider son mari dans les charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Ayawavi is a married woman, aged 36, who lives with her husband and her six children in Lomé. Ayawavi sells flip-flop sandals in her district and manages successfully to support herself. She gets her supplies at the Akodessewa market twice a month to have a constant inventory. For a new order for flip-flops, Ayawavi is requesting this loan to purchase new flip-flops, to offer a nice range of them to her customers, and to make more profit, so as to help out her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 100 pairs of flip-flops

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for six months. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Sidra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Sidra's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Sidra  also plans to make savings with the profit amount from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Sidra is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard lives with her son and daughter in Basen village, Shirak region. Her elder son is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country. Because the unemployment rate in the region is very high, her sons have to leave their home with the hope of finding well-paid jobs and sustaining their family's living.

Nvard runs a farm with her daughter. They keep livestock of cows, calves, sheep, and hens, as well as cultivate wheat and barley. To be able to enlarge their farm production, Nvard asks for this loan. She plans to purchase seeds for land cultivation, fertilizer, and cover fuel costs for renting an agro machine.

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during the recent times, Nvard was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments.

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds for land cultivation, fertilizer, and to cover fuel costs for renting an agro machine.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is 42. He is from Khoost. He has had a business selling used men's footwear for about five years. At this point he is renting a facility at a market to sell his merchandise. Viktor owns a vehicle which is an important asset for a businessman like himself. 

Viktor has been planning to remodel his bathroom for quite a long time. Any kind of remodelling in Ukraine is pretty costly, which is why Viktor realized that he wouldn't be able to cover the cost all by himself and decided to seek assistance from Kiva. He is hoping to use 40,000 UAH (Ukrainian hryvnias) to finally remodel the bathroom in the house that his family inherited from his parents. The house has needed many renovations and repairs. At this point Viktor has decided to work on the bathroom which has been in terrible condition.

loans.use: to remodel the bathroom in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial kitchen and cooking utensils

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de jornalero y agricultor contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, cuenta con más de 4 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más herramientas para realizar su trabajo así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales herramientas ya que se encuentran en mal estado, con esto Nicolas espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 40 years old and married. He lives with his family in the Oyotún district, in a rural area that is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. Life in the community is peaceful. Its inhabitants make their living in agriculture and livestock breeding.

He makes a living by working as a day laborer and a farmer. He has his own work tools, and he has more than 4 years of experience in this line of work. He also has very good personal and professional references in the area. He is requesting a loan to buy more tools to complete his work and to do maintenance on his current set of tools, which are in bad condition. With this, Nicolas hopes to provide better service to his customers. This will allow him to have greater earnings, which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more tools to complete his work and to do maintenance on his current set of tools, which are in bad condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical expenses (the surgery of her daughter)

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.en:
Doraliza is a sari-sari (convenience) store owner from Merida, Leyte. She is 40 years old, married and has three children.

Doraliza has been in the business for more than 12 years now, and this is the source of her income. Doraliza is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, and cooking condiments, among other things. A loan will help her improve her inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store.

In the future, Doraliza hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, and cooking condiments, among other things

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her for it will surely help fund her children's education and their daily sustenance. 

Salvacion dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las principales actividades económicas que desarrollan los pobladores de este distrito son la agricultura y el comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio esta ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mejoramiento del lugar donde cría a sus animales (corrales), dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones a sus animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Pablo espera mejorar la productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo is 51 years old and married. He lives with his family in a rural area in the Oyotún district, which is in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. The main occupations of the district’s inhabitants are agriculture and commerce.

He makes a living by breeding and selling animals. He has more than 3 years of experience in this line of work. His business is located in the rear part of his home. He is requesting a loan to complete repairs and improvements to the area where he raises his animals (corrals). This investment will allow him to keep his animals in better conditions, which will have a big influence on his business. With this, Pablo hopes to improve the productivity of his animals and to be able to meet the diverse needs and preferences of the customers in the area. This will increase his income level and, similarly, improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to complete repairs and improvements to the area where he raises his animals (corrals).

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: 36-year-old Chanthou is a married woman with four young children that have not yet started school. They live in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham Province. She is a rice farmer, while her husband is a construction worker, in order to provide for the family. She has been farming rice for 14 years. This is her second time borrowing from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loan enabled her to buy a motorbike. As the leader of her group, she is applying for a loan of 600,000 KHR to buy good quality rice seed for her farm. She hopes to have a higher yield.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is a 35-year-old, married woman with 5 children. 

Basheeran is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands, and her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads and frames to meet her customers' orders on time and to earn a good amount of profit. 

This financial will help to take Basheeran closer to her dream of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads and frames to meet her customers' orders on time and to earn a good amount of profit

loans.name: Sinov's Group

texts.en: At 26 years of age, Sinov is a young mother of two little children who are both under six years old. They reside in a small village of Sandan district of Kampong Thom province. To earn a living, Sinov has been farming rice and growing vegetables for sale. Her daily income is just above 2 USD. She has borrowed from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, once before. Now as the leader of her group, Sinov is requesting a loan of 280,000 KHR to build a toilet at her home. She hopes that her family will be healthier with a proper toilet.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer muy perseverante y solidaria tiene una hermosa familia de 4 hijos, es casada vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Eva es una señora que para conseguir sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo para mantener a la familia se dedica a la venta de atol en una aldea circunvecina de su comunidad, este negocio lo realiza ella desde hace 20 años, ella aprendió a preparar atol gracias a la enseñanzas de su madre quien también se dedicaba a este negocio, a Eva le gusta esta actividad porque a través de esto se relaciona con mucha gente, ella se a puesto ahora ver sus necesidades y una de las primordiales es la construcción de su cocina pues ella donde prepara su atol es una galera pero una de los problemas que Eva tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder hacerlo es por ello que solicita un prestamo para que lo utilizará para la construcción de su cocina.
Ella sueña contar con este prestamo para que pueda tener una su cocina donde pueda preparar mejor su atol.
texts.en:
Eva is a very persevering and supportive woman. She has a beautiful family with 4 children. She is married and lives in the community of Suchitepéquez.

Eva is a woman who sells cornflour drinks in a village neighboring her community to earn her income and to support her husband in supporting their family. She has been doing this work for 20 years. She learned to make the cornflour drink thanks to the lessons of her mother, who also did this work. Eva likes this activity it allows her to meet many people. 

She is in a position now to see her needs, and one of her main needs is building her kitchen, since where she makes her cornflour drinks is a galley. One of Eva’s problems is that she doesn’t have enough money to have a kitchen. It is because of this that she requests a loan so that she can use it for the construction of her kitchen.

She dreams that with this loan she can have a kitchen where she can better prepare her cornflour drink.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and iron to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una señora de 58 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez, tiene una hermosa familia de 2 hijos pero ambos ya se encuentran casados.
Ana es una mujer que no se limite ante nada pues a pesar de su avanzada edad ella todavía tiene fuerzas para trabajar, ella se dedica a la elaboración de  ropa típica y para luego venderlas, realiza esta actividad des de hace 8 años, según cuenta Ana que a ella le gusta esta actividad porque le permite desde su casa poder vender y obtener sus ingresos. Ana con el afán de incrementar su negocio ha decido realizar un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar, telas, hilos y modernizar sus blusas y cortes típicas.
El sueño de Ana es que con esta inversión podrá mejorar sus ingresos y vivir una vida con comunidades.
texts.en:
Ana is a 58-year-old woman. She lives in the community of Suchitepéquez. She has a beautiful family with 2 children, but both are already married.

Ana is a woman who has not been limited by anything, since despite her advanced age, she still have the strength the work. She is dedicated to making traditional clothing and then selling the garments. She has been doing this work for 8 years. Ana says that she likes this work because it allows her to sell from her house and earn income. 

Ana, with goal of growing her business, has decided to take out a loan that she will use to buy fabric and thread to modernize her traditional blouses and skirts. 

Ana’s dream is that with this investment she will be able to improve her income and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Khatoon Kausar

texts.en:
Khatoon Kausar is a 40-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 20 years, and he is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Khatoon Kausar's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories), but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items listed above for his business purposes. Therefore, Khatoon Kausar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories listed above to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Khatoon Kausar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tailoring accessories

loans.name: Kamon

texts.en:
Kamon is a 45-year-old married woman. For many years, she has been involved in the business of the cloth trade. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from a city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

She is in her 4th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. Kamon wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 56 years of age. 

Her great skill in hand embroidery and her 4 years' experience in this field have given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown, and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her 8 children. 

Bushra is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR with which she wants to purchase more spools of threads, a measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. 

She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, a measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cinderblocks, iron, cement and gravel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Areqnaz

texts.en:
Areqnaz is from Meghrashat village, where she lives with her husband and son. Her elder son is a migrant worker and other family members help Areqnaz with running a farm. They keep livestock of cows, calves, sheep, and hens, plus they cultivate wheat.

Now, Areqnaz asks for this loan to purchase potato seeds, fuel, and fertilizer for land cultivation. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately was not able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Areqnaz was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fuel, and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.es:
Don Asencion cuenta con una sonrisa muy conmovedora los logros que tuvo en su último cultivo de frijol, que sin duda lo hicieron crecer. Este agricultor se siente muy agradecido con el préstamo que le brindó MiCrédito, con la ayuda de KIVA y todos que son parte de esto y que le extendieron la mano para cumplir con resultados exitoso en la inversión de semillas, abono y herramientas para esa siembra. 
Ahora se acerca la nueva temporada, la cual desea supere el triunfo que logró don Asencion con la última cosecha. Razón por la cual no duda ni un segundo en seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar un quintal de frijol para semilla y para pagar a trabajadores que le apoyaran en este nuevo cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Esta inversión facilitara el proceso de siembra y mejorara su calidad. En sus planes este agricultor de 58 años de edad piensa comprar una vaquilla para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Asencion has a very moving smile. The success he had during his last bean harvest undoubtedly caused that smile to grow. This farmer feels very thankful for the loan that MiCredito gave him, with the help of Kiva and everyone who is a part of this and who lent him a hand. They allowed him to have successful results from his investment in seeds, fertilizer, and tools for sowing time.

Now, the new season is coming, and he wants to exceed the success he had in the last harvest. For this reason, he doesn’t doubt for a second that he should keep investing. This is why he is requesting a new loan to buy 100 pounds of beans to plant and to pay workers that will help him with the new corn and bean crops. This investment will facilitate the sowing process and will improve quality.  Amongst his plans, this 58-year-old farmer is thinking of buying a heifer to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy 100 pounds of seeds and to pay workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, blocks, cement, iron, stones, etc.

loans.name: Mayline

texts.en: Mayline is a diligent mother. She is 39 years old and has two children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and already working while her youngest child is still studying. Her husband is a laborer in a rice mill. Mayline has been in a hog raising business for nine years. The income generated from her business is not enough to cover their daily needs. With regard to this matter, Mayline is asking for a loan of  5,000 Philippine pesos to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes that she will be able to improve their living conditions and educate her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy purlins, blocks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Damas Unidas  está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona bastante alejada de la zona céntrica que aún está en crecimiento, es de difícil acceso.
La Sra.  Justina es una de las integrantes, ella sale a vender a sus postres y también comidas saladas que ella misma hace, es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, y es conocida por las ricas comidas que vende. Es una persona muy emprendedora y luchadora que hace de todo para poder ayudar a su familia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y demás
texts.en:
The group called “Damas Unidas” (“United Women”) is in its fourth cycle with the program of female groups. The group is from the city of Concepción, which is an area very far away from the central area but is still growing. The area is difficult to access. 

Mrs. Justina is one of the members. She sells desserts and savory food that she makes. She is a person who is very good at what she does, and she is known for the rich food she sells. She is a very enterprising and hard-working person, who does everything so that she can help her family.

She is thankful for the opportunity she receives, and she asks for this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, green vegetables, and other things.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, green vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber and zinc.

loans.name: God's Hand Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called God's Hand which was created and inaugurated in February, 2010. Its members are women who share a strong bond and believe in development through teamwork and team spirit. Their main activity is small trade in ladies' tops, underwear and charcoal.

Veronica (standing in the middle of the photo) is the featured borrower. She is married with two children, one girl and one boy. She sells ladies' tops and underwear in a kiosk at her residence.

She will use this loan to buy more ladies' tops and underwear at GHS 2,500.

With her profits, she plans to reinvest part and support her children's education with the other half. She will also bolster her savings. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' tops and underwear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es:
Teodocio tiene 32 años, está en pareja con la Sra. Teresita, con quien tiene un hijo que nació hace unos pocos meses, y quien es la persona más importante para ambos.
Teodocio emprendió su actividad como costurero hace más de 11 años, se independizo hace dos años, luego de trabajar 8 años con otras personas, mediante mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo adquirir su primera máquina de coser y de esa forma poder formar su propia clientela.
Teodocio es un señor muy sacrificado quien se esfuerza diariamente para brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de telas ya que cuenta con muchas demandas para confeccionar uniformes con el comienzo de año lectivo.
texts.en:
Teodocio is 32 years old. He is married to Señora Teresita, with whom he has a son who was born a few months ago and who is the most important person for both of them.

Teodocio began to work in sewing more than 11 years ago. He became independent 2 years ago, after working for 8 years with others. Through much effort and sacrifice, he was able to acquire his first sewing machine and in this way be able to form his own customer base.

Teodocio is a very sacrificing person who makes a daily effort to offer the best to his family. He needs the loan to purchase fabrics, since he has many orders to make uniforms with the beginning of the school year.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothing

loans.name: Andresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Andresa es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Manuel de 59 años de edad, tienen 4 hijos, todos ya mayores, que pudieron criar con el esfuerzo y lucha de ambos.
Tiene una Despensa en su casa, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, además su marido se dedica en la venta de mandioca por la ciudad de Santaní, tiene una camioneta para el reparto de sus productos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, leche, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andresa is from the city of Santaní, and she is 57 years old. She is married to Mr. Manuel, who is 59 years old. They have 4 children, all of whom are already grown-up. They were able to raise their children through the effort and fight of both parents.

She has a store in her house with well-established clients, a good income, and good professional and personal references. Also, her husband sells yucca through the city of Santaní. He has a small truck for distributing his products.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest in buying various supplies to supply her store, including vegetables, meat, condiments, milk, bread products, and other things. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, milk, bread products, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to sell more milk and educate his children

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Progresistas es un grupo antiguo, bastante unido, pasaron al sexto ciclo con 17 integrantes. Todas son mujeres trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante siempre.
Una de las integrantes del comité es la Sra. Gregoria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, cuenta con todo tipo de marca de prendas, ella es una señora muy emprendedora e independiente. Pone todo de sí para poder salir adelante e ir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias como shorts, remeras, pantalones, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y a través de ello poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Progresistas” (“Progressive Women”) is an old group that is very unified. They completed their sixth cycle with 17 members. All of the members are hard-working women, who always have the desire to go forward.

One of the members of the group is Mrs. Gregoria, who sells different types of clothes. She has all types of clothing brands. She is a very enterprising and independent woman. She puts everything she has into going forward and improving everyday. 

She asks for this loan to be able to buy various clothes, including shorts, t-shirts, pants, and other things. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. Through this, she will be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy various clothes for sale, including shorts, t-shirts, pants, and other things.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a married woman and a mother of two children living in Leyte, Philippines.  She earns a living selling firewood and other items, and also earns additional income through fish vending.  

Bernadette is requesting a loan to buy more firewood and fish to sell to her customers.  A loan will help Bernadette improve her business as well as her income. 

In the future, Bernadette dreams of improving her livelihood.  Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aparacio

texts.es:
Aparicio tiene 63 años, él está casado, y tiene hijos, es una persona que se esfuerza y siempre se esforzó por su familia, para poder darles una vida digna.
Aparicio emprendió su actividad hace más de 15 años, tiene su local de ventas de comidas y bebidas en un mercado, ella con la ayuda de su familia  y el esfuerzo de muchos años puede ofrecerles una buena vida a sus hijos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias e insumos como carne, verduras y otros para hacer sus comidas.
texts.en:
Aparicio is 63 years old. He is married and has children. He is a person that works and always makes an effort for his family, so that he can give them a dignified life.

Aparicio learned his work more than 15 years ago. He has a store where he sells food and drinks in a market. He does this with the help of his family, and he has worked for many years so he can offer his children a good life. 

He asks for this loan to be able to invest in buying various drinks and supplies, including meat, vegetables, and other things to make his food.

loans.use: to buy various drinks and supplies, including meat, vegetables, and other things to make his food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is a farmer from Nshavan Village, in the Ararat region of Armenia.  She lives with her husband and two children.  The farm she runs includes hens and arable land where she cultivates sunflowers, eggplant, and grass as forage for the animals. 

Roza requested this loan to enlarge her farming business.  She needs to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse.  As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative by Kiva and SEF.  The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi is farmer living in Lehvaz village with her husband, two daughters (the elder one is in the picture), and mother-in-law. Varduhi's husband is an army officer, and she is the only one who takes care of the family's farm. 

Varduhi keeps livestock of one cow and 20 goats on her farm. She also owns a small orchard with fruit trees growing there (apricot, plum, cherry, nut, apple and pear). 

Varduhi asks lenders to support her with purchasing one cow, 10 goats and some forage for feeding the livestock. This is her first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for one cow, 10 goats and some forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Hina Bibi

texts.en:
Hina Bibi is a 25-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 20 years. He is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Hina Bibi's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Hina Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Hina Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories, of her husband.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Mientras el sol asoma sus resplandecientes brazos antes de mostrarse completamente, don Ramón se levanta para cuidar de su cultivo, según la temporada. Este hombre trabajador de 51 años de edad, es productor agropecuario, cultiva maíz, frijoles y ordeña vacas desde hace más de 30 años.  Él cuenta con orgullo cómo inició su negocio independiente, luego de apoyar a su familia, y es que con las dos vacas que le obsequió su madre empezó su historia, haciendo crecer un ganado y cultivando lo que por tantos años cultivó con sus padres.
Dicen que después de la tormenta llega la tempestad y así fue el caso de Ramón, puesto que al ser afectado por el huracán mitch, decidió levantarse con más fuerzas que nunca. Ahora este hombre emprendedor, padre de tres hijos y esposo de una increíble mujer que lo apoya, quiere seguir viendo crecer su negocio. Por esta razón es que solicita un crédito para comprar de comida gallinaza para su ganado. Con esta comida podrá mantener saludables y productivas de leche a sus vacas. En sus planes está mejorar los cercos de su finca y seguir alimentando saludablemente a su ganado.
texts.en:
While the sun begins to extend its shining arms before showing itself fully, Ramon gets up to take care of his crops, depending on the season. This hardworking, 51-year-old man is an agricultor and livestock producer. For more than 30 years, he has farmed corn and beans and milked cows. He proudly tells the story of how he started his independent business after supporting his family. His story started with the two cows that his mother gave him. From this, he created a flock and started cultivating the same things he had cultivated with his parents for so many years.

They say that after a storm comes the true struggle, and that was the case for Ramon. After being hit by Hurricane Mitch, he decided to get back up with more strength than ever. Now, this entrepreneurial man, who is the father of three children and husband to an incredible woman who supports him, wants to keep growing his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy food for his cattle. With this food, he will be able to keep his cows healthy and milk producing. His plans include improving the fences in his farm and to continue nourishing his cattle in a healthy manner.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. 

For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. 

She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 50-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of five children. 

She has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. She is keen to provide her family with the best living conditions through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. 

She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Moqadas

texts.en:
Moqadas is a 54-year-old, widowed woman. 

She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Moqadas has requested a loan of 45,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 30-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Atiya Batool

texts.en:
Atiya Batool is a 35 year-old-woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children and her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible, but due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Atiya Batool has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Surxay

texts.en:
Surxay is a farmer and he is 32 years old. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Füzuli city, and now he lives in Füzuli region. He is single and lives with his parents. Surxay has been raising cows for six years. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in the local bazaar. 

Today Surxay wants to buy two calves for his farm. For this reason, he needs 1,000 Azerbaijan new manat, and therefore, he has applied to Komak company for a loan. He is thankful to Kiva organization for the help. In the future, he wishes to develop the industry, increase his income and get married.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Thermos, sodas, and juices.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a 56-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She operates a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Dolores is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, cooking oil and condiments. 

Dolores believes that a loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. Dolores wants to expand her sari-sari store in the future in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en: Lolito is a 38-year-old married man and a father of three children from Merida, Leyte. He earns a living through his firewood and charcoal retail business. Lolito has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Lolito is asking for a loan to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Lolita hopes to expand his business in order to generate more income. Moreover, Lolita wants to save money to pay for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Serine

texts.en:
Serine lives with her husband in the village of Agarak in the Lori region of Armenia. They have been running a farm since they were married many years ago.
