Currently, their farm includes livestock such as a pig, piglets, hens, calves, and three cows. The couple also organizes the cultivation of wheat, corn, and potatoes. 

To be able to feed their livestock, Serine is asking lenders for their support. She needs to purchase forage to feed their farm animals. 

As this is Serine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not previously have access to credit products because they lacked credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed her livestock.

loans.name: Tangulu

texts.ru: Тангулу, 33 года, замужем, мать 6 детей. У Тангулу среднее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством, начав бизнес 7 лет назад. На данный момент в хозяйстве Тангулу имеется корова с теленком, лошадь и 10 овец. На ежедневной основе она продает молоко и молочную продукцию (топленное молоко, курут, сузмо). На участке мерою 2,5 Га собственной земли Тангулу выращивает люцерну и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход Тангулу составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тангулу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Tangulu is 33 years old, married and the mother of six. Tangulu has received secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she raises livestock, having launched this business seven years ago. At present Tangulu has a cow with a calf, a horse and 10 sheep on her farm. She sells milk and dairy products (baked milk, "kurt" [traditional dried yoghurt] and "suzmo [a type of sour cream cheese] ) on a daily basis. She also owns a land plot of 2.5 ha [6 acres], where she grows sainfoin [a plant used for animal fodder] and wheat. Tangulu's monthly income is about 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, she has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy calves and increase her livestock. Tangulu plans to invest her revenues in a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to increase her herd.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is a teacher working in a local school in Zorakert village. She lives with her husband and together with him, after her work in the school, she is also involved in farming. They keep livestock of three cows, calves, eleven sheep, and hens. Realizing how important their agricultural income is for their living, Hasmik would like to increase her livestock. She applied for this loan to purchase six sheep.

She had already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Hasmik has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Therefore, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for six sheep to increase her livestock.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a teacher from Vahagni village, Lori region. She is a divorced woman living with her mother-in-law and six-year-old daughter. To be able to sustain her family, Anahit works hard. She is a teacher at a local secondary school. After her work at the school, Anahit is also involved in the sale of clothing supplies. Besides all this, Anahit runs a farm with the help of her mother. 

Anahit is specialized in beekeeping. Currently, she has 60 colonies of bees. The honey which they gather is sold in nearby communities. To be able to purchase sugar, beehives and pesticides needed for increasing her honey production, Anahit has applied for this loan. 

Anahit has taken out a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, she wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Anahit has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, beehives and pesticides needed for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Nyanyo Kpakpa Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Nyanyo Kpakpka (Good Friend) and they are on their ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses run by the members include ornaments, wigs, smoked fish, kenkey (cooked maize paste) and charcoal. The loan that they will receive will benefit micro businesses like Doris'. 

This is Doris' fifth year with ID-Ghana. She joined after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a business selling ornaments and wigs. She began this business through a cousin, who showed her how to acquire and sell this product. The loan that she has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase ornaments and wigs to sell to customers. She will purchase the products from the distributors and later sell at the market. 

This job allows her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are kind.

loans.use: to purchase ornaments and wigs from the distributors to later sell at the market.

loans.name: Naseem Bibi

texts.en:
Naseem Bibi is a 40-year-old lady and a responsible mother of two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own bike showroom business for the past 20 years. 

Naseem Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of things like bikes, tables, chairs and other relevant items for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these merchandises. 

To fulfill the needs of her husband, Naseem Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy these merchandises for business purposes. That will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Naseem Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of things like bikes, tables, chairs and other relevant items for her husband's business

loans.name: Rasheeda Bibi

texts.en:
Rasheeda Bibi is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past one year and he is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Rasheeda Bibi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Rasheeda Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Rasheeda Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items that her husband wants to increase his business

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a hog raiser within her village. She currently raises two fattening hogs. She has been involved in this kind of business for ten years. 

Jonalyn would like to take out a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to be used in buying hog feed, medicine and vitamins needed to keep her hogs healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. Jonalyn is looking forward to approval of her requested loan. In this way, she can obtain better income and cover all her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicine and vitamins needed for her hog raising business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay the costs of higher education (tuition and monthly payments for the new academic year)

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira lives in Lorut village with her husband and two sons (ages 17 and 16 years old). She has been involved in a farming business for ten years already. Elmira's farm includes livestock of cows, calves, sheep, piglets and pigs. Elmira also cultivates potatoes on a plot of land near her house. 

Elmira has applied for this loan of USD 800 to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This is her first loan, so it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 47-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children. 

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en:
Arevhat lives in Marmarashen village with her son, husband and retired parents-in-law. Arevhat is a farmer. She cultivates sunflowers and greens and also keeps a grape orchard. Her family members help her greatly with farming work. 

To be able to enlarge grape production, Arevhat asks for this loan. She needs to purchase wires for enlarging her grape orchard and pay for the transportation and workforce. This is her first loan and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for wires for enlarging her grape orchard and pay for the transportation and workforce

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en: Evangelina is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines.  She is engaged in a hog raising business. Evangelina has been in the business for more than three years now. Her husband is a farmer. Evangelina is asking to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business and improve her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dresses, shirts, and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Gulnaz Bibi

texts.en:
Gulnaz Bibi is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for ten years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to have maintenance done on his taxi because its current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to have maintenance done on his taxi. Therefore Gulnaz Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Gulnaz Bibi's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And he can provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Gulnaz Bibi also plans to have savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in future.

Gulnaz Bibi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 57-year-old married woman. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit. This monetary help can take Rukhsana closer to her dream of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Claires Vitalia

texts.es:
Claires es una mujer de 45 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 26, 23, 20 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad en una tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amable, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘La arboleda’ un área caracterizada por agrupar a empresas y oficinas de todo tipo. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente entre 21-35 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Claires es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo lo usa estilo cola de caballo, ojos claros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; los 3 mayores son independientes y el menor inicia sus estudios en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, huevos, harina, arroz, fideo, refrescos, pañales para bebé, etc., en su tienda de barrio ubicada en su mismo domicilio. “inicie mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar mientras cuido a mi hijo pequeño, en poco tiempo la gente que ya me conocía y gente que no me conocía vino a comprar y ahora vienen a diario…” comenta. Su meta es establecerse como la tienda más popular y surtida del lugar, ella desea realizar la compra de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad para abastecer y surtir su tienda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claires solicita un préstamo para abastecer y surtir su tienda con alimentos y productos de primera necesidad para establecerse en la zona.
texts.en:
Claires is a woman of 45. She lives with her partner and has four children, ages 26, 23, 20, and 6. Her business is selling foods of primary necessity in a neighborhood store.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, friendly, patient, responsible, and hard-working. She set up her business in the Arboleda neighborhood, an area characterized by the grouping of businesses and offices of all types. The area has a warm, tropical, and humid climate with an ambient temperature between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade, which varies during the day.

Claires has a golden-brown complexion, long, black hair that she styles in a pony tail, light-colored eyes, short stature, and a robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in commerce, and with her children. The three oldest are independent, and the youngest is beginning school. They live in their own house made of bricks with a tile roof, which has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system. 

Her business is selling foods and products of primary necessity, such as bread, sugar, eggs, flour, rice, pasta, soft drinks, diapers for babies, etc., in her neighborhood store located in her same residence. "I began my business out of the need to work while I took care of my little son. Soon the people who already knew me and the people who didn't know me came to buy, and now they come daily," she comments. Her goal is to establish herself as the most popular and best-stocked store in the area. She wants to make the purchase of foods and products of primary necessity to further stock her store. This is her first loan with the institution in the year that she has been developing this business.

It is for these reasons that Claires is applying for a loan to stock her store with food and products of primary necessity to establish herself in her zone.

loans.use: to stock her store with foods and products of primary necessity to establish herself in the zone.

loans.name: Inobathon

texts.ru: Инобатхон проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 31 лет. Она замужем и пока не имеет детей. Инобатхон любит животных, и поэтому она занимается животноводством. Она занимается выращиванием скота четвертый год. Инобатхон покупает молодых телят и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке.  Она научилась у родителей. Ей в работе помогает муж. Инобатхон обратилась за кредитом, чтобы расширить деятельность. Инобатхон за счет денег купить несколько молодых телят. С помощью этого кредита она может продвигаться дальше и улучшить условий жизни семьи.
texts.en: Inobathon is 31 and lives in the Pyandj district. She is married and does not yet have children. She loves animals and that is why she raises livestock. She has been raising cattle for four years. Inobathon buys young calves, fattens them for the necessary amount of time, and then sells them at the livestock market. She learned this business from her parents and her husband helps her with the work. Inobathon applied for a loan to expand her business. She will buy a few young calves. With this loan she will be able to continue her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her livestock business and buy young calves

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder  ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cristina quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando su situación de pobreza extrema por medio del esfuerzo y trabajo continuo.  Ella se dedica al forrado de jarras que después sale a vender, comenta que se hizo de clientela ya que vende a determinados negocios y con ese trabajo da a su familia lo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de jarras, cueros, cola de pegar y otros, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its first cycle of the program of the Women’s Committee, in which everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are doing the elimination of poverty survey, in order to determine the circumstances of each member and, taking this into consideration, be able to go ahead improving their situation.

One of the members is Señora Cristina, who, in her last survey, showed a poverty level of three, which indicates that she has improved her situation of extreme poverty by means of effort and continuous work. She earns a living making leather-covered pitchers or jugs that she later sells. She says that she has developed a clientele, since she now sells to certain businesses and with this work, she provides her family with the necessities. She is asking for this loan to purchase jugs, pieces of leather, adhesive and other items and, with these, be able to continue with her work as she has been doing, struggling to improve her life.

loans.use: jugs, leather, adhesive and other items

loans.name: Elenorie

texts.en: Elenorie is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of six children, from Leyte, Philippines. She would like to avail herself of a loan to buy stock for her store such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and bread and biscuits. A loan will help her improve her store’s inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store. Elenorie dreams of making her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en: Roderick is involved in a hog raising business. He has been in this kind of business for five years. Roderick is seeking additional capital of 5,000 Philippine pesos to allow him to buy feed, vitamins and medicine for his hogs. He knows that the improvement of his business relies on his own hard work and wise management. Roderick will be grateful if lenders grant his requested loan.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicine for his hogs

loans.name: Lucenia

texts.en: Lucenia is selling native delicacies and vegetables within her locality. She has three children who are 11 years old, 9 years old and 8 years old. She plans to purchase the necessary ingredients such as glutinous flour, coconut, sugar and glutinous rice to make native delicacies to sell but her income is not enough. With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes to obtain her requested loan in order to sustain her family needs and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy necessary ingredients such as glutinous flour, coconut, sugar and glutinous rice to make native delicacies to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Agustina is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown children, from Merida, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Agustina also earns additional income through hog raising. She is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments among others. She also wants to buy additional piglets to raise. Agustina believes that a loan will help her improve her business, thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments among others.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. Letecia lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. She runs a small beauty parlor in her place. 

Letecia has been in the business for more than six years now. Letecia is standing with some of her products which she uses in her parlor. Letecia is asking to take a loan to buy more hair products for her shop, like shampoo, conditioner, hair coloring and others. This loan will help her improve her stocks, thus allowing her to cater for more customers in her beauty shop. 

In the future, Letecia has hopes of making her business more stable and profitable. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more hair products for her shop, like shampoo, conditioner, hair coloring and others.

loans.name: Audrey

texts.en:
Audrey is 30 years. She is married to Barrington and together they have been blessed with two school-going children. Audrey sells clothes, a business she has done for the last five years earning a monthly income of Kshs 30,000 now.

Audrey has applied for her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 20,000, which she will use to add more stock of clothes and jewelry so as to attract new clients, add more profits and in turn, educate her children and provide health care for them.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children and provide for their healthcare needs.

Audrey hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes and jewelry so as to attract new clients, add more profits and in turn educate her children and provide for their health care needs

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 60 years old. She is married with four children between 15 and 37 years old. Two of the children go to school. She sells bed sheets and has been in business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bed sheets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anzhik

texts.en:
Anzhik runs a farm. She lives with her only son Edgar in Jrapi village. After the death of her husband, Anzhik left the country and went to Russia. But last year she came back to her motherland, renovated the house by her own means and bought cattle and sowed winter wheat. Anzhik and her son work now hard to develop their farm and make it bigger. To make their goals come true, Anzhik asks for lenders' support. She plans to purchase five calves and forage for feeding the livestock. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for five calves and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.en:
Jeannine is 25 years old. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 months and 5 years. 1 of her children goes to school. 

While her husband is a driver, Jeannine owns a bar, and she has been running this business for 8 years. 

With the loan she has requested, Jeannine would like to buy more beer to sell. Her profits from the business will be used to both pay her child's school fees and renovate her house. 

Jeannine hopes to improve her business by 95%.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 23-year-old university student majoring physical education.  She is in her third year.  Her father is retired from the army. 

Nawal is aiming to get her bachelor's so that she can continue her study and register for her master's.   Because she doesn't have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan is from Ijevan town. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law. Her husband currently works in a neighbouring country as a migrant worker to support his family financially.

Ruzan herself is a student. She studies in State University's Ijevan branch in her fifth course of studying. She is asking lenders to support her with university tuition. She will be very grateful for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en:
Munaza is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working for a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his family. Munaza is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Munaza is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her business.

loans.name: Zinduka Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 50s, is married with six children who are still in school. She has been running two projects, a pub and a retail shop for ten years now. She works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rose's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the drinks and to buy the drinks which are fast moving in her pub and to restock the out of stock items in her retail shop. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to pay for the loan due, saved some in her bank account and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more drinks for her pub and to increase the shop stock. She dreams of building her own house.

Rose will share this loan with her loan group "Zinduka" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to  to buy more drinks for her pub and to increase the shop stock.

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Mussa is in his mid 40s, single, and has two children. For the past ten years, Mussa has been running a food stand where he sells fried fish, juice, and milk. In the evenings he goes door-to-door selling fabrics to earn additional income. He works from 8am to 10pm daily to earn a fair monthly profit. 

Mussa has received several loans from Tujijenge in the past and has successfully paid them back. He used those loans to improve his food stand and purchase more fish. He plans to use the current loan to purchase a fridge for his business. He hopes this loan will help him earn more profit so he can build his home and provide food for his family. 

Mussa will be sharing this loan with his loan group, Dove, which consists of one other person. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and a fridge for his food stand.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo varón de 2 años y una hija mujer de 1 años, y su negocio es la confección.
Ella es buen madre, independiente, constante, responsable, emprendedora y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Ballivian’ ubicada al norte de la ciudad donde las casas todavía tienen la esencia de ser la muestra de antaño, con un muro bajo y descolorido, hechos de simple adobe, por ello y con el avance arquitectónico ya algunas simples  moradas han pasado  a ser galerías de consumo, en el mercado de oferta y demanda, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Marlene es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, usa lentes de aumento, de ojos obscuros y baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que son bebés y todavía no están en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de mochilas, ella recibe pedidos de sus clientes, y realiza la confección de mochilas de todo tipo y color, para niños y diseños serios para adultos. Labor que realiza en un taller propio en su domicilio. “confeccionamos prendas por temporada, edredones, mochilas, ropa, todo aquello que demande el sector…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y ser dueña de una marca. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de telas y materiales de confección de mochilas como; telas de diferentes colores, cierres, hilos, etc., Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marlene solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de confección de mochilas para ofertar mayores diseños y diversificar sus productos.
texts.en:
Marlene is a 29 year old woman, is married, and has a son who is 2, and a daughter who is 1.  She has a sewing business.  She is a good mother, is independent, persistent, responsible, enterprising, and hard-working.  

Her business is set up in the "Ballivian" zone, located to the north of the city where the houses still have the essence of being the sign of days gone by,  with low, faded walls, and made from simple adobe.  Because of and with architectural advances, some of the simple dwellings have become shopping centers in the market of supply and demand.  The area has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that ranges between 0-12 degrees celsius during the day.

Marlene has brown skin and long black hair she usually ties up in a ponytail.  She uses glasses and has dark eyes.  She is short and thin, and her native language is Ayamará, which she speaks with her family.  She speaks Spanish for general use as well as for her business.  She shares her life with her partner who works in the same business as she does, and with her children, who are still babies and are not yet old enough to go to school.  She lives in her own home built from brick and adobe, with a corrugated iron roof.  Her home has potable water, electricity, gas, and a sewer connection.

Her business is in sewing backpacks of every type and color, for children, and serious designs for adults.  She performs her work in her own workshop in her home.  "We sew garments for the season, quilts, backpacks, clothing, anything that the area needs..." she comments.  

Her dream is to expand her business and be the owner of a label.  She wishes to make an investment in her business through the purchase of fabric and sewing materials for the backpacks, such as: fabric of different colors, zippers, thread, etc.  This is the first time she has requested a loan through the institution in the four years that she has conducted this business.  It is for these reasons that Marlene is requesting a loan to buy materials to make backpacks, in order to offer the most designs and diversify her product.

loans.use: to buy materials to make backpacks, in order to offer the most designs and diversify her product.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is a 29-year-old, sari-sari or retail storeowner, from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has been in the business for 10 years now. This is her source of income. Miraflor is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, among others. In the future, Miraflor hopes of expanding her store in order to generate more income. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
For the past two years Monica has been running a local money transfer business known as M-PESA. Since the last year the business is doing great. Monica is 29 years old and a single mother of one child who is fours years old.
 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 100,000 and she intends to use the entire amount to add more float, which is the money for the M-PESA transactions, so that she can serve her customers well. Monica plans to use the anticipated income to plough back into the business, and in the future she plans to grow her business, be financially stable, and be able to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to add more float, which is the money for the M-PESA transactions.

loans.name: Martha Arcadia

texts.es:
Doña Martha es una mujer carismática, luchadora y con múltiples virtudes que desde hace 30 años se dedica a la venta de tamales rellenos y la comercialización de CD`s. Ella ha logrado invertir en la compra de materia prima como el maíz que utiliza para elaboración de tamales.  
Ahora doña Martha solicita un crédito para incrementar el inventario de CD`s y tamales para de esta forma poder mejorar sus ganancias y calidad de vida, a la vez, darle la oportunidad a su hijo mayor que le ayude en la administración del negocio. Entre los planes de esta mujer emprendedora esta seguir trabajando y luchar por administrar bien su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is a charismatic, hard-working woman with many abilities who for thirty years has worked selling stuffed tamales and marketing CDs.  She has managed to invest in the purchase of raw material such as corn that she uses in making tamales.   

Right now Martha is asking for a loan to increase her inventory of CDs and tamales and in this way to be able to improve her earnings and quality of life as well as be able to provide opportunity for her oldest child who helps her in the management of the business.  Among the plans of this entrepreneurial woman is to continue working and striving to manage her business well.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of CD's and tamales

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Chuka, located in the central Region of Kenya, is a famous rain fed area. Despite the area having no drought, crop failure is a common occurrence. Poverty is a permanent companion of the farmers. Rocky soils, underfed cattle, poor farming techniques and a poor road network are the natural scenes of the area. However, Mr. Samson is determined to make a fortune in such a situation. Samson is seeking a loan to purchase a hybrid dairy cow. For the past 10 years, Samson has been keeping traditional breed dairy cattle on his farm just like most of the farmers in the region. He has also been growing bananas and vegetables. But still, he was not making enough money to meet his needs. He was pushed to engage in other personal businesses to make a decent income. With your loan, Samson will acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce adequate litres of milk a day to enable him to generate enough income to repay the loan and save some extra money. Investing in Samson will enable him to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, Irish potatoes and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 31 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 6 months and 12 years. Three of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs, and she has been in business for four years. Her husband is a businessman. With this loan, she would like to buy more green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Philemon. He is a hardworking mixed farmer based in Kapsowar, which is a small rural town in Kenya. He has a lovely family. He has been practising farming for 13 years. His primary income sources are milk, maize and vegetation produced on his farm. He also engages in personal businesses to make extra money. 

Philemon is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He enjoys taking care of animals very much. His hobby is milking early in the morning and late in the evening. He chops fodder in between during the day and fills water in troughs for the cows to drink. He regularly inspects his animals to ensure they are healthy and the milk quality is great. Philemon finds farming enjoyable, lucrative and full of growth opportunities. His biggest challenge is the poor roads leading to the market. This makes it expensive and time-consuming to ferry farm produce. 

With your loan, Philemon seeks to improve his family's living standard. He fully understands the loan obligations and is committed to paying his debts fully.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea, who is a 29-year-old married mother, lives in the village of Rupoti in Georgia. There, she lives with her husband, mother, and school-aged daughter and son. 

Sadly, because she lacked economic resources and had to start working at a very young age, Tea was unable to study for a professional career. She works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing vegetables. Also, she and her husband care for 4 dairy cows and 20 sheep. They always produce high-quality products which are sold to local retailers at a good price. 

Tea wants to start her own private business and is seeking credit from local financial institutions. The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables inexperienced, rural individuals to access a loan to start or re-start businesses. 

Tea's application was approved under this framework, granting her a loan of 3,000 USD so she can start a pharmacy. She will be able to purchase the medical supplies and equipment needed to open the pharmacy in her village. The business will be profitable, Tea believes, as it will have a great location and be the only business of its kind in the area. 

This hard-working woman will be very grateful for the help from this loan, as she will get the chance to have her own business and generate additional income for her family's welfare.

loans.use: To open a pharmacy in her village.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 57-year-old Ugandan woman, who is divorced with five children, but only one attends school and she is responsible for paying her school fees. Mary is a farmer who grows bananas and cassava as her major source of income. She has been doing this since 1998 to raise funds to support her family as a single mother.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from UGAFODE to help her to pay school fees for her child. She expects to pay it back using proceeds from the sales of her agricultural produce. Her dream for the future is to educate her remaining child and see her finish school.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is a conservative woman and asked her son to take her place in the photo. 

Afaf has always wanted to provide her children with the best education. Her 21-year-old son is a university student majoring in Arabic language and is in his third year. He chose this major because he likes to learn more about his language and wants to work as a teacher. He is seeking to pass his Bachelor's so that he will experience work life.

Because of the financial crisis of Afaf and her husband have been faced with, Afaf can't pay for her son's upcoming semester fees. For that, Afaf wants to help her son by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university fees.

loans.name: Rock Of Ages Group

texts.en:
This group is called 'Rock of Ages 1' and consists of five members who are all hard-working. They live in Chorkor-Accra, Ghana and are requesting a loan of GHS 4,000 from ID Ghana, Kiva's field partner. 

Sabina, 33 years old, is married and is the featured borrower. She studied until secondary school but couldn't complete her studies. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She wants to improve the condition of her house by purchasing cosmetics and selling them to customers. She has requested a loan of GHS 700 in order to buy the cosmetics. She has been doing this business for 10 years now and is on her second loan from ID Ghana. 

Sabina looks forward to increasing her savings with ID Ghana and improving her family's living standards. Sabina is standing far right in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Llama De Amor 5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Llama de Amor (Flame of Love) 5, which is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children and her long term partner. She enjoys working and spending time with her family. 

Maria is excited to be taking her 20th loan with Kiva field partner, Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to invest in her colmado, which is a small grocery store located in the neighborhoods, where she sells daily meals ingredients like rice, beans, sugar, and other food products. Her business profits are used to provide for her family's needs and to increase her inventory. 

One of Maria's dreams is to have a successful business and give her children a safe and comfortable life, with all they need on time. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, flour, canned food, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila, from the city of Samana, is taking a housing loan. This is her fourth loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has a miscellaneous products business where she sells different products for the home. Her latest loan was invested in the business.

Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown faithfulness in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as they are running their businesses and attending their group meetings.

Petronila wants to finish building her house. With this loan, she will buy tiles for the floor, windows and doors, and other building materials. She wishes to have a safe and nice home to share with her family. Thanks to God's will, she will be able to take a closer step to finish building her home, and she can save more from her business profits. 

She thanks God, Esperanza International, and all of you for this opportunity. 

On behalf of her and her family, thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy tile, windows and doors

loans.name: Agape Group Musoma

texts.en:
Ghati, who is in her early 30s, is a divorcee with three children; one son and two daughters.  She has been running two projects; buying and transporting small dry fish an having a retail shop.  She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ghati's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy items like sugar, rice, beans, soap, cooking oil, etc. and to increase the amount of small dry fish stock.  She is doing great and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase the amount of small dry fish and transport them to the upcountry to restock the out-of-stock items in the retail shop inventory.  She dreams of opening a big wholesale shop.

Ghati will share this loan with her loan group, Agape Group Musoma, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the amount of small dry fish and transport them to the upcountry to restock the out-of-stock items in the retail shop inventory.
